Welcome to Centura Health
Welcome to the largest health ecosystem in Colorado and western Kansas. Welcome to living your mission among thousands of people on fire to live theirs too. Welcome to options, possibilities and values that guide exceptional care. Welcome to extremely important industry challenges and opportunities to solve complex problems. Welcome to highly intelligent teams, overflowing community and the wholeness of mind, body and spirit that is Centura Health.
Flourishing Begins Here
You have a purpose, unique talents and NOW is the time to embrace it, live it and put it to work. At Centura Health, we value incredible people with incredible skills - but your commitment to a greater cause is something we value even more.
Under general supervision, the Enterprise Operations Analyst is responsible for providing basic system administration support functions for servers, network, storage, applications, and security. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate and resolve malfunctions and make the appropriate recommendations to maximize the benefit of IT systems. They will respond to system and applications alerts and warnings and perform routine system maintenance as well as tier II problem resolution when appropriate. They will communicate system interruptions or incidents in consultation with departmental or technical decision makers. Successful Enterprise Operations Analysts are strong analytical thinkers who enjoy solving problems and thrive in a high-pressure environment with shifting priorities.
What You Bring/Job Requirements
In addition to bringing your whole self to the workplace each day, qualified candidates will need the following:
3 years progressive experience in an information systems environment
A broad degree of knowledge in IT application and infrastructure architecture
Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment with a customer service approach
Understanding of customer needs and clear focus on customer satisfaction
Excellent ability to follow documented processes
Highly self-motivated, works with minimal supervision
Ability to build collaberative relationships, strong customer service orientation
Demonstrated excellence in oral and written communication skills
Functional knowledge of Windows 7/10, Windows Server 2012/2016, VMWare, Exchange (on premise & cloud)
Network and server experience, preferred
HS Diploma/GED, required
Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics, preferred
ITIL V3 Foundations Certification, preferred
Schedule
:

Thursday-Saturday (12 hour shifts) and every other Wednesday
Physical Requirements: Sedentary work -(prolonged periods of sitting and exert up to 10lbs force occasionally)
Your Connected Community
When people and places align, incredible things happen. Just like the 21,000+ amazing associates who work here, every community within Centura Health's connected ecosystem has its own unique history, story and personality.
Centura Health is headquartered in Centennial, CO, with additional business office locations throughout the Denver Tech Center. The Corporate Service Center is home to our leaders and centralized teams that support our hospitals, clinics and people - including marketing, human resources, employee benefits, finance, billing, talent acquisition/development, payor relations, IT, project management, community benefit and more. Whether you work in the corporate headquarters or one of our nearby offices, you'll experience a culture of collaboration and community where incredible people are doing incredible things every day.
Caring for Your Whole Well Being
We're committed to delivering whole person care and understand that a comprehensive benefits package will enrich the lives of our associates at work and at home. At Centura Health, we offer incredible benefits that impact mind, body, and spirit to eligible associates. Our total rewards are designed with your well-being in mind and may include: - 401K, which includes matching when eligible - Three Health Insurance Plan Options including covering eligible dependents - Two Dental Insurance Plan Options including covering eligible dependents - Vision Insurance including covering eligible dependents - Daycare & Medical Flexible Spending Account Options - Leaves of Absence, Short Term Disability, and Long Term Disability - Life Insurance and Spouse & Child/Dependent Life Insurance Coverage Options - Voluntary Benefits including Hospital Indemnity Coverage, Critical Illness, Accident, Permanent Life insurance, and Norton LifeLock - Paid Time Off - Shift Differentials - Employee Wellness Resources - Employee Assistance Programs - Tuition Reimbursement - Relocation assistance based on location - Associate Discounts for Phone, Cell Phone Plans, Auto Insurance, Home Insurance, Auto Buying, Pet Insurance, and much more... The pay rate for this position is listed above and varies based on experience, skills, and comparison to others who are already in this role. *If you do not see the pay range for this position listed, you are on a third party job board. All of our pay ranges are clearly posted on our careers site www.centura.org/careers. Please visit our Careers page and apply today!

Start Here
Finding a job can be overwhelming- plowing through dense, super specific job descriptions, spending hours filling out applications, and then, if you’re lucky, you get a tag-team interview that leaves you spinning.
Not here.
At Canvas, we’re dedicated to transforming financial services and that includes welcoming and championing the most incredible people. We aren’t ashamed to say that working here is delightful. We’re a family. The time we spend together is full of support, camaraderie, and fun. Make no mistake, we’re serious-minded professionals who take our responsibilities to heart and love serving others.
Who We Are
We are Canvas and we are passionate about disrupting the way people experience financial services. “Helping you afford life” and “People before profits” aren’t just advertising taglines for us. They’re literally words we live by. Shareholder profits don’t drive us. Our members, our families, and the communities we live and work in are all that matter here. (World peace and protecting the environment are super important too.) We’re strong supporters of the credit union movement, of providing our members with the education, support, and guidance to build strong, independent financial futures.
And we want your help.
General Purpose
The Business Analyst is the point of contact between the business and the IT Team. They are responsible for interpreting business unit project needs and translating project requests into actionable information for the IT Team.
Essential Duties/Responsibilities
Understand business processes and underlying information in order to translate business needs into formal, documented business requirements, functional requirements, workflows, user stories and/or use cases.
Elicit, document, analyze, communicate, test and verify requirements.
Analyze data quality and propose changes with the processes that are maintainable, efficient and repeatable.
Coordinate project team tasks and activities, schedule definition, system testing, training, system/application configuration, and other implementation activities, including vendor communications as required.
Research and document existing processes impacted by projects.
Prepare system/application documentation as required.
Perform administration tasks (system operations, etc.) as necessary.
Coordinate and complete special projects and activities as assigned.
Clearly communicate technical solutions in a user-friendly, professional manner.
Exhibit support for the organization’s goals, values, initiatives and cost control.
Recommend and help develop and implement new policies and procedures. Ensure suggested changes adhere to all Canvas Credit Union policies, procedures and regulatory requirements.
Comply with the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) and other compliance requests and requirements.
Follow all safety and security guidelines to properly safeguard member and organization assets.
Embrace ongoing education and learn/apply new skills and software applications sufficient to be a resource for the development team.
Regular attendance and punctuality are essential functions of the job
Perform other job duties as assigned.
Job Qualifications
Knowledge, Skill and Ability:
Solid knowledge and understanding of Canvas Credit Union financial products and services.
Strong relationship building and teamwork skills with ability to develop and maintain consultative relationships with Canvas Family members.
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
Proven ability to develop project plans, coordinate and complete projects on time and within budget.
Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills; ability to manage multiple priorities with tight deadlines.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Strong technical aptitude for new technology.
Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
Proficient in MS Office.
Ability to maintain confidences.
Must be bondable through CUNA Mutual for employment with Canvas.
Pre-employment drug test and thorough background review (components include: criminal, employment, address, social security number, motor vehicle record, global sanctions, sex offender, and credit).
Education or Formal Training: Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent work experience.
Experience: Two to five years of business analyst experience; preferably in a credit union environment. Advanced knowledge of Symitar (Episys) and Microsoft Office Suite preferred. Experience with Agile/Scrum development frameworks and PMO tools desired.
The starting pay range for this position is $69,000.00-$79,000.00, and final pay rate will be determined based on experience and internal equity factors.
Working Environment/Physical Activities
High volume, fast-paced, dynamic office environment with some travel. Must be able to attend meetings and events outside of regular business hours. The job routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, printers, copiers, fax machines and filing cabinets. The position requires manual dexterity, the ability to lift files and open filing cabinets. The position requires bending, stooping, or standing as necessary.
Other Duties
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Company Description
Zayo provides mission-critical bandwidth to the world’s most impactful companies, fueling the innovations that are transforming our society. Zayo’s 133,000-mile network in North America and Europe includes extensive metro connectivity to thousands of buildings and data centers. Zayo’s communications infrastructure solutions include dark fiber, private data networks, wavelengths, Ethernet, and dedicated Internet access. Zayo serves wireless and wireline carriers, media, tech, content, finance, healthcare and other large enterprises.
Position Description
The Business Analyst is a strategic position that plays a pivotal role in the data integrity of Key Zayo functions. The position is responsible for assisting the Business Operations team and Strategic Operation Organization build, maintain and enhance dashboards, data models and data pipelines. The right candidate will possess advanced analytical and decision-making skills. The role requires someone who is passionate about data quality, data analytics and automation in order to drive business strategy. An ability to be an expert in problem solving, critical thinking, and an understanding of complex system dependencies are essential in enabling the Business Analyst to show where Zayo processes are broken and how those processes are affecting key data points. An individual with a strong passion to solve problems and improve data integrity will excel in this position. In addition, this individual has to have a knowledge of pulling unique datasets across different objects within Salesforce. This will help with the additional responsibility of maintaining databases that feed into objects in Salesforce and dashboards in Analytics.
The Business Analyst must be an effective communicator, a good listener, and have strong interpersonal skills that will assist in cross team collaboration.
Responsibilities
Work with other areas of the business to drive enhanced data, operational reporting and analytics platform
Build, maintain and enhance dashboards, data models and data pipelines
Use SQL or other query languages to create complex datasets across multiple tables in Zayo’s Salesforce warehouse
Identify and automate inefficiencies in the methods the organization currently uses to gather important business data by developing a systemic framework as well as improve data flows
Provides governance on data accuracy and ensures integrity of data components in key analysis projects and playbooks
Run processes that use data to identify market and business trends to increase profits and efficiency
Implement and maintain methodologies for tracking and reporting on key business operational and financial metrics
Understand, utilize, and maximize our data, in Salesforce.com and other databases to optimize business insights
Qualifications
1+ years of data analysis experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Analytics, Operations Management, Data Science, or other Quantitative Field
Ability to understand and create charts, graphs, and data visualization models
Advanced skillset in Microsoft Excel and G-Suite applications
Aptitude for learning new/different processes within the company to better understand other data architectures and workflows
Knowledge of Salesforce.com
Intermediate experience with Einstein Analytics, Tableau or other data visualization software
Ability to create reports and dashboards within Salesforce.com
Passion for creating a data driven culture and delivering value
Ability to coordinate across teams and disciplines to drive process improvements and automation
Self-starter who is able to tackle work in an unstructured environment, comfortable with ambiguity
Strong desire for teamwork and working in group settings
Ability to adapt to change quickly, as well as manage a high-volume workload efficiently and effectively
A team player who can collaborate naturally on high priority projects and initiatives
Strong attention to detail and ability to multi-task and prioritize
Strong financial acumen and a passion for data
Must be highly organized and a strong communicator both written and verbal
A general understanding of telecom is preferred
Rewards
Competitive compensation
Base salary range: $55,191-$60,285
Full-time Zayo employees are also eligible for discretionary quarterly short-term and long-term incentive cash bonuses which are based on the performance of the Company, an employee’s business segment, and the individual employee
Excellent benefits including health, dental, vision, 401 (k), disability and life insurance
Fitness membership discounts
Generous paid time off policy including paid parental leave

Description: Is Sooper Credit Union the right place for you? Does compassion and the financial well-being of others give you satisfaction and motivation?If your helpful and understanding nature guides the actions in your daily life, harness your superpower and join us to help create an unforgettable member journey. Our organization values your contributions toward making a difference in the life of each individual member!Why Sooper Credit Union?As not-for-profits and member-owned financial cooperatives, credit unions are incredibly unique institutions. Earnings are returned to members in the form of better rates, lower fees and great services. Be a part of a movement that pays it forward!Sooper Credit Union was founded in 1951. We’re a stable, successful and growing financial institution, which is why we need you.A suite of outstanding benefits is available to employees who work 20 or more hours a week. In addition to healthcare, dental and life insurance, 401(k), personal time off, we offer employee discounts on loans and various other perks.Learn a ton with our on-the-job training programs and set yourself up for professional and personal successWork in a strong culture with coworkers dedicated to supporting our Core Values: PROMISE (Personal, Respect, Our Community, Members, Improvement, Support, Empowerment)What will you be doing?Work with stakeholders to identify reporting needs and translate them into business and data definitions.Develop complex SQL queries, stored procedures, reports (standard and ad-hoc), dashboards, scorecards and KPIs to provide fast, accurate, and meaningful insight into company data.Contribute to the design and maturity of the business intelligence program.Work with other areas of Information Technology to support the credit union’s technology stack.Share your knowledge and ideas on everything from effective practices to ways we can better support our membership and teams.Champion data-driven decision-making; identify automation opportunities and improve processes.. Requirements: What makes you a great fit?You are an energetic self-starter. You have the ability to communicate effectively with all departments and levels within the organization. You have the ability to see beyond data; you can understand the business need behind data requests.Ideal candidates will possess:Experience with a variety of BI tools such as SQL, Excel, Power BI, and Tableau.Experience with TSQL, stored procedures, and modeling data.Ability to analyze data and turn it into insightful reporting to assist in management decisions.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Initiative to learn, self-improve and expand your skillsets.The ability to understand complex concepts and effectively communicate them to non-technical audiences.Strong understanding of data warehouse and relational database concepts.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.An understanding of financial services and the credit union industry.If you think you are the superhero to bring unforgettable experiences to our members and help grow our thriving organization, please apply. We appreciate your interest in employment and look forward to meeting you!This is a full-time, non-exempt position with an hourly rate that equates to $60,000 - $70,000 annually.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

What we are about

Synaptic AP™ is a silver-tier Salesforce implementation consulting partner specializing in the development and deployment of secure, cloud-based enterprise applications on the Salesforce platform.

Since 2008, we've helped businesses solve critical operational challenges and accelerate growth across a variety of complex verticals. Our mission is to help clients get the most out of their Salesforce investment with world-class professional services and applications. Join us. We love our team and our customers.

With passion and innovation embedded in our DNA, we go out of our way to encourage our employees to share new ideas and feedback on a regular basis.

Who you are

As a successful, team-centric professional, you're a strong oral and written communicator who is comfortable presenting to groups. You have a keen attention to detail and are exceptionally good at identifying inconsistencies and flaws. You can juggle several balls and not lose track of the little things. You're looking for a role with substantial opportunities to learn, grow, and take on more (the good news is, we have that stuff in spades!).

What you will do

The Business Analyst's primary responsibility is to understand the needs of the customer. The Business Analyst is expected to conduct requirements gathering meetings, ensure adherence to the project scope, support the solution design, help implement the design, test the system, and make sure the solution is maintained. The Business Analyst is also expected to be knowledgeable about the Salesforce environment (understanding capabilities and limitations) and actively participate in the solution development. This position requires the ability to perform the following:

Requirements Analysis: conduct requirements gathering sessions to elicit, define and document detailed business and technical requirements
Process Design: develop user stories and to-be process flows to support the design and development of Salesforce solutions
Solution Design: work closely with the Solution Architect or Technical Architect to explain the requirements and ensure the design meets all of the identified requirements
Solution Configuration: complete configuration/customization tasks using Salesforce's click configuration framework (no coding capability required)
Quality Assurance: prepare and execute QA scripts, track QA process from beginning to end
End User Training: prepare end user training materials customized for each project, deliver training to Client Trainers and/or end users.
Change Management: Identify and document how business processes impacted by each project will change. Develop guidance to prepare workforce for upcoming system launch

The Business Analyst plays a critical role in Synaptic's success of product delivery and client satisfaction and therefore must consistently strive to meet or exceed our clients' expectations.

Skills and experience you need to be successful

Related Bachelor's degree
1+ years of experience as a Business Analyst focused on delivering enterprise software solutions
Excellent written and oral communication, presentation, and customer service skills
Experience soliciting, gathering, and analyzing user input and requirements
Experience documenting user stories and creating process flow diagrams
Experience documenting requirements and communicating with a technical team
Hands on experience configuring Salesforce including workflows, validation rules and security controls
Ability to manage efforts across multiple projects
Be a team player with strong interpersonal skills

Skills that would be a bonus

Current Salesforce Consultant certification (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, etc.). A Consultant certification will be required within the first 90 days of employment
Experience with Agile/Scrum
Experience with Jira, Confluence, Smartsheet, LucidChart, and mind mapping software
Experience with change management

Location

This position is based in either of our offices in Annapolis, MD and Stuart, FL or remote. 10-20% travel may be required.

We have
An amazing team focused on doing #Whateverittakes to help our clients and teammates be successful
A calling to innovate and improve every day
A competitive benefits and compensation package
Room for rapid growth and an emphasis on talent development
A fun, casual team environment with cool co-workers who will make you feel like you are an important part of our team, engage you in developing new solutions to challenging problems, and help you leverage your strengths to make all of us better!
A great benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, AD&D and Life Insurance coverage, employer paid short term disability coverage, wellness initiatives, and more!
Competitive Paid Time Off (PTO) package that includes time in service increases, Volunteer Time Off (VTO), 7 Holidays, and flexible work schedule

Synaptic Advisory Partners is an equal opportunity employer, who participates in E-Verify. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, gender, religion, age, disability, veteran's status, or any other classification as required by applicable law.

Business Intelligence AnalystJob Status: Full-timeCompensation: Salary-Based (rate will be commensurate with experience level)Description & DetailsCompany:  Tamarron Consulting (www.tamarronconsulting.com)Location:  Denver, COIndustry:  Consulting – Beverage DistributionJob Function:  Data Management, Data Analysis, Creative / Design / Multimedia, Data Visualization, Business Intelligence Reporting & DevelopmentYears of Experience:  0-2 years professional experience (as long as required skill sets are present)Description: Tamarron Consulting is a management consulting firm specializing in the beverage distribution industry. As the beverage industry continually evolves, Tamarron assists distributors and suppliers with developing progressive, yet practical strategies for keeping pace with complex industry changes. We are unique in our exclusive focus on adding value to the relationship between suppliers and distributors. The following areas represent Tamarron Consulting’s primary lines of business: Performance Surveys, Mergers and Acquisitions, Business Valuations, Improving Business Practices and Management Training. Business Analytics is a new area of focus for Tamarron.Responsibilities of the position will include: The Business Intelligence Analyst will be primarily focused on Performance Surveys and Compass Data Insights. Specific tasks will include receiving survey data collected through online survey platforms like Alchemer (Survey Gizmo), importing the data into Excel, normalizing and standardizing the data, analyzing the data and translating the results into professional management-level reports and dashboards in Excel and PowerPoint. Responsibilities will include data ETL, database maintenance, and the development of BI dashboards, KPIs, and data visualizations. This may also include integrating new datasets and sources with existing data stored in a relational database. You will work closely with NielsenIQ, our primary data partner.Qualified candidates will possess the following: Excel – advanced knowledge of Pivot tables, functions like V-lookups, VBA, expert knowledge in structuring data and creating professional management-level reports and Excel dashboardsPowerPoint – advanced knowledge of PowerPoint functionality including the ability to customize and create new graphics and create C-level deliverables for clientsWorking Knowledge in Business Intelligence and Data Visualization toolsExperience working with a BI tool such as Power BI, Looker, or Tableau including report development, KPI development, and data visualizationsStrong SQL skillsExperience working with relational databases or data warehouses (MySQL, Snowflake, Amazon Redshift, PostgreSQL, etc.)Comfortable and highly proficient in working with large sets of data in spreadsheets and/or databasesExperience with a scripting language like Python or R; experience working with dataframes specificallyStrong desire to learn new data analytics skills and data platforms (e.g., Nielsen Answers on Demand platform, advanced Power BI features)Strong analytical capabilities – ability to develop concise reports from raw dataHigh attention to detail with drive for all data to tie together; must be able to consistently produce work that is accurate and error-free; patience to drill down into data discrepancies to resolutionExcels in a work environment with a high level of autonomy; enjoys solving ambiguous and challenging problems related to dataProfessional writing skills – ability to write clear, concise verbiageCandidate must be over 21 years of age due to industry regulations*Tamarron Consulting is an at-will employer. These duties are subject to change at any time in the sole discretion of Tamarron Consulting.Application Qualifications Desired AttributesThe following attributes are desired for this position.Desired Degree:MBA, MSDesired Major/Concentration:Data / Business Analytics, Information ManagementJob Type: Full-timePay: $59,000.00 - $83,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceHealth savings accountPaid time offSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:SQL: 1 year (Preferred)Business Analysis: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:One locationCompany's website:www.tamarronconsulting.comWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetings

Essential Job Functions
***Typical Hiring Range: $54,400 - $62,000 annually***
***Salary to be commensurate with qualifications***
Responsible for the oversight, planning, analysis, and technical support of El Paso County’s business incentive programs. Conducts research on business trends to assist with identifying business needs. Monitors business incentive programs, developments, projects, and efforts.
Oversees El Paso County Economic Development Department’s business incentive programs. Ensures continuous Federal, State, and Local compliance with all program elements.
Develops, analyzes, and submits research on economic development needs. Compiles data and prepares complex written and/or statistical reports.
Collaborates with County leadership to develop strategic incentives aimed at attracting businesses to El Paso County; implements strategic incentives and identifies and recommends areas of needed improvement.
Responsible for community outreach, to include identifying businesses eligible for incentive programs. Serves as a liaison to business partners in the community by assisting with efforts to provide business incentive opportunities.
Responsible for the administrative components of special business incentive districts/zones or programs.
Administers the El Paso County Business Loan Fund. Monitors contractor compliance and provides consultation related to Business Loan Fund. Resolves issues and assists in negotiating matters related to performance of required outcomes. Completes annual contract renewal.
Responsible for the components associated with the administration of the Urban Renewal Review Committee.
Responsible for the County's appropriate issuance of Private Activity Bonds (PAB) for industrial development purposes. Processes applications, presents to PAB Committee, and coordinates with bond counsel to ensure legal compliance.
Coordinates and attends periodic interagency consultation, applicant, project level, and planning meetings; prepares meeting addenda and documents outcomes and resolutions.
Resolves issues related to assigned areas. Exercises independent judgement within well-defined and established guidelines/practices to determine appropriate action.
Coordinates/collaborates with Economic Development leadership in addressing complex business issues or concerns.
Spearheads special business incentive projects as assigned.
Performs other duties as required.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree with major coursework in economic development, public administration, business administration, planning, or related field.
Two (2) years experience in economic or business development.
Previous experience implementing and analyzing business incentives and/or business attraction/retention strategies preferred.
Ability to utilize software that compiles and analyzes economic data. Ability to write concise, logical, and grammatically correct analytical reports.
Knowledge of scope and application of Local, State, and Federal laws and regulations pertaining to economic development and planning practices.
Ability to comprehend complex financial issues and recommend/implement targeted solutions.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Strong organizational and time management skills with attention to detail. Must possess good grammar, spelling, and punctuation skills.
Ability to demonstrate sound judgment by taking appropriate action within defined guidelines and practices.
Ability to communicate and work effectively with coworkers, County personnel, external agencies, and the general public.
Ability to operate computers and standard office equipment, working knowledge of Microsoft Office to include Word, Excel, and Outlook.
Maintain regular and punctual attendance.
An equivalent combination of related education and experience may be substituted for the education and experience requirements above.
Must pass conditional post offer background investigation, motor vehicle record check, and drug screen.
Licenses/Certificates
Must possess and maintain a valid Colorado Driver's License.
Work Conditions
Work is primarily performed in an office environment; some travel may be required.

FirstBank Lubbock Bancshares began with the vision of one man, Barry Orr, and a promise. Barry promised his wife and friends that he would start a bank that would become profitable through relationships, hard work and determination. "It is our goal to be the BEST community bank in the Lubbock area," states Barry Orr, Chairman & CEO. "We knew we could help build a better Lubbock by serving the needs of customers our way."
The Commercial Business Analyst Team Lead is responsible for partnering with front-line leaders to ensure the processes, performance, and reporting for Commercial Banking support at bank subsidiaries of Heartland Financial USA, Inc. (the “Company”), meets the standards required to meet the goals of the banks and business line. In addition, the Commercial Business Analyst Team Lead manages the Commercial Banking analysis and effectiveness reporting function outside the sales arena.
PRIMARY & ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Manages the Company’s Commercial Banking loan support function with the support of Commercial Banking loan support supervisors at the bank level.

a. Identifies opportunities and develops processes to improve efficiency of the Commercial loan support function.

b. Ensures consistent accountability standards for the support function.

c. Ensures clear definition and communication of responsibilities and gearing ratios for the support function.

2. Conducts analysis of commercial banking processes across the Company; identifies ways to improve and standardize processes; and manages other Commercial Banking Analyst(s) who support this responsibility.

3. Oversees business management reporting for Commercial Banking outside the sales arena.

a. High level summaries of the performance of all business lines under Commercial Banking – Treasury Management, Retirement Plan Services, Commercial Card, Commercial Lending.

b. Individual Commercial Banker portfolio analysis

c. Bank-level portfolio analysis.

4. Demonstrates the ability to successfully learn and support the credit administration support function for the specialty vertical function within Commercial Banking through targeted activity as assigned.

5. Supports the Heartland Commercial Banking team on execution of day-to-day initiatives for identified lines of business

6. Supports the reporting/analytics, marketing and sales enablement, project management, and operational administrative services

7. Assists with providing and maintaining tools to assist leaders in translating the Commercial Banking vision into business objectives, strategies and financial expectations

8. Assists with M&A due diligence and any subsequent acquisition integration as it relates to Commercial Banking.

9. Helps identify and maintain a prioritized listing of high impact, cross-functional projects which focus on process, sales enablement and data flow improvements. Serves as project lead on assigned projects.

10. Assists with the implementation of policies and procedures to achieve Commercial Banking tactical and strategic business goals.

11. Identifies business challenges and opportunities for improvement.

12. Works closely with colleagues across Heartland including: Technology, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Product and others to drive improvement in quality, volume, and profitability.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Supervises and coaches Commercial Banking Analysts

2. Works with Heartland’s recruitment team to hire the most qualified and talented individuals to fill open positions for the function.

3. Provides information and on-going feedback to department staff regarding expectations and performance. Addresses performance issues in a timely manner.

4. Prepares and conducts annual performance reviews and professional development discussions.
REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
1. 3-5 years’ experience assessing data, leading to key considerations and proposing recommendations

2. Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or related field.

3. 3-5 years of commercial banking, treasury management and/or commercial card experience preferred

4. Prior management experience preferred

5. Ability to leverage the capabilities of a high-performing team, as well as business partners across the enterprise.

6. Excellent sales and thorough knowledge of operational processes

7. Good negotiating skills to work with customers, banks and service providers to identify/create service options that work and add value to the customer

8. Strong expertise in secondary credit risk management and audit controls

9. Current understanding of regulatory compliance issues relating to banking

10. General understanding of commercial credit policy. Strong working knowledge within the banking industry, treasury operations, accounting and corresponding banking

11. Strong executive communication skills both oral and written, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills

12. Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access) and database software.

Schedule Weekly Hours:
40
Time Type:
Full time

job_title: Business Systems Analyst - Manufacturing Line Monitoring and Quality
description:
Ball Corporation manufactures aluminum packaging for beverage, personal care and household products, and provides aerospace and other technologies for commercial and government customers. We have been in business for over 140 years and is leading the charge in creating solutions that keep our planet healthy. Ball Corp has been nationally recognized as a leading company in the creation of sustainable products (Fast Company World Changing Ideas award) as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity (Forbes Magazine.) Join our team of over 18,000 people worldwide in our quest to make the world a cleaner and healthier place. BE BIGGER THAN YOURSELF. BE UNSTOPPABLE. BE AN INSPIRATION. JOIN US IN MAKING THE WORLD A BETTER PLACE.
Primary Purpose of the Position:
The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) ensures the proper collection and documentation of business requirements that can be understood by both business and technology stakeholders to improve the effectiveness of the business function, responsible for requirements to be consistent with the business case and the long-term plans within the capability/service delivery area. The BSA also leads user acceptance testing to ensure the solution is aligned to the business requirements, driving resolution of any potential defects where necessary.
Essential Responsible Areas:
Accountable for developing, defining, and documenting business requirements that describe the business need and solution scope, and communicate them effectively to IT and business stakeholders
Remain up to date of technology trends, opportunities, compliance, and regulatory requirements within a defined capability/service delivery area
Provide process expertise to others to understand the impact of system enhancements on the company’s processes and to understand how system functions and processes will generate the intended outcomes for business
Collaborate with solution architects, adhering to enterprise architectural frameworks and roadmaps to design processes, systems, and information/data architectures
Build and maintain an in depth knowledge of the processes, systems, and data in a defined capability/service delivery area
Responsible for writing functional specifications that can be used by solutions/systems engineers to support the creation of technical designs and delivery of business and technical requirements
Responsible for communicating documented defects to technical team members, create and validate proposed defect resolutions (fixes) from systems/solutions engineers, ensure that the initial defect was corrected, and that initial data and/or processes will not be impacted
Coordinate user acceptance testing to ensure business requirements are satisfied and ensure proper UAT documentation is produced (based on use cases and test requirements)
Ensure proper training, transition, and cutover plans are developed and executed to ensure proper user adoption and minimize business disruption.
Provide project management support for small/medium size projects, being responsible for project planning and execution of work required, including issue management and status reporting.
Position Requirement & Competencies:
Broad training in a related field usually acquired through college degree level education or work-related experience
BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, Marketing, Information Systems Management, Computer Science or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience
5+ years of related work experience with progressively increasing responsibility
Experience creating core BA deliverables (e.g., functional spec, test cases, etc)
Ability to work in global, multinational and remote teams in a matrix organization
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills (written and oral)
Demonstrated ability in IT analysis methodologies (e.g., process flow definition, data flow diagramming, use case definition)
Demonstrated ability to work effectively with all levels of staff, customers and other IT Personnel
Proficiency using the Microsoft Office suite including Visio or similar applications (e.g., LucidChart, OmniGraffle, etc)
Solid knowledge of technologies relevant to the capability/service delivery area
Working knowledge of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Working knowledge of project management methodologies (e.g. Agile, Waterfall) and activities/deliverables(e.g., work planning, status reporting, issue management)
Ideal candidate will have as much of a combination of experience with the following:
Knowledge of plant line monitoring processes and procedures preferred
Rockwell FactoryTalk for Line Monitoring preferred
DELMIA Apriso for Manufacturing Execution Systems preferred
Knowledge of Quality Management processes and procedures preferred
Ignition by Inductive Automation for line process interface is a plus
Demonstrate Ball Leadership Behaviors:
 Inspire
Demonstrates Self-Awareness: Uses a combination of feedback and self-reflection to gain productive insight into personal strengths and weaknesses
 Connect
Instils Trust: Gains the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity and authenticity
Interpersonal Intelligence: Relates openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people
 Achieve
Demonstrated Results: Consistently achieves results even under tough circumstances
Compensation & Benefits:
Hiring Salary Range: $86,500 - $132,000 (Salary to be determined by the applicant’s education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data.)
Job Grade: [[12]]
Other Compensation: This role will be eligible to participate in the annual incentive compensation plan.
Regular Full-Time Salaried and Hourly positions: Ball includes a comprehensive benefits structure, Go to our career site and click "Total Rewards" to learn more.

These often appear legitimate, but Ball does not make job offers until after a candidate has submitted a job application and has participated in a face-to-face interview (In person or via WebEx). All email correspondence from Ball Corporation ends in “@ball.com.” Please also be advised that Ball will never request payment or require candidates to deposit a check during the recruitment and onboarding processes. If you have questions about any open positions at Ball, please visit our careers website at https://jobs.ball.com/.
If you have applied to a position and have been asked for personal information through LinkedIn, please notify LinkedIn directly.

It's exciting to work for a company that makes the world measurably better.
We're committed to bringing safety, quality, and customer focus to the business of advanced ceramics manufacturing.
Job Title
Sales Operations Business Analyst
The Sales Operations Business Analyst will be responsible for analyzing internal Commercial Group business data to determine and recommend appropriate courses of action based upon that analysis. This analysis could include, but is not limited to the following data sets: Pricing data, revenue or margin data, Customer Relations Management (CRM) usage and improvement plans, budget analysis, and headcount analysis. May be assigned specific project management duties including business management of CRM application, Sales and Operations Planning (S&OP) application, or other commercial back office tools as required. Recommends and implements operational objectives of a complex nature with supervision and oversight.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Collaborate cross-functionally with Operations, Finance, IT, and others to ensure data alignment, integrity and validation
Enable data-driven decision making through both data cleanliness and business analytics
Provide business analysis to support corporate metrics, especially as they relate to the Commercial organization
Develop customer-friendly reporting and deliver analytics to support CoorsTek growth in its target markets
Recommends best practices and influences internal teams to adopt new models, tools, and practices
Supports global business objectives for Sales Operations and the Commercial group
Job Requirements:
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Operations, or similar, or equivalent experience.
Experience:
Minimum of 2 years of experience in business analysis and/or, sales operations or planning roles
Suport of Sales Operations analytics and business processes.
CRM or S&OP application knowledge and implementation experience of same, or equivalent
Support of implementation of complex global business objectives with moderate supervision.
Functional/Technical Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Experience in managing forecasting processes across multiple markets or business units is a plus.
Strong business analytics skills and ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to communicate effectively cross functionally and to any level of the organization.
Strong skills in several business analytics platforms (Excel, Tableau, Cognos, etc).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are a must.

Description of Job
The Work Unit:
The Data Visualization and Analysis unit is responsible for: (1) developing, maintaining, and enhancing automated processes that bring together surveillance data from multiple sources relating to the COVID-19 pandemic (2) aggregating, analyzing, and displaying COVID-19 data for Colorado; (3) responding and fulfilling data requests; (4) responding to media inquiries; (5) developing, maintaining, and updating the infrastructure and environment for COVID-19 related data; (6) coordinating across CDPHE and external agencies for COVID-19 data access and improvement.

What You'll Be Doing:
This position will be responsible for maintaining and further enhancing a library of Tableau visualizations for internal and public use. This position will also be responsible for developing new visualizations relating to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Data visualization, integration, and analysis
Maintain an existing library of Tableau visualizations and associated underlying sql code that extract and transform data from multiple existing surveillance systems and/or a single standardized warehouse environment.
Develops new visualizations and enhance existing visualizations as systems change, new systems come online, and processes change in the source surveillance systems.
Develops processes in sql to combine data across sources and implement methods to increase record completeness in the overlaying visualization.
Performs ad-hoc analyses and generate summary statistics.
Works collaboratively with colleagues to create data sets that are rapidly visualized in Tableau.
Publishes visualizations on Tableau Public daily at 4pm.

Documentation
Develops, maintain, and enhance documentation for all work done in Tableau.
Develops, maintain, and enhance documentation for all automation processes.
Other duties as assigned
Due to the rapidly evolving nature of the COVID-19 pandemic, other duties will be assigned as appropriate.
Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal Rights
Minimum Qualifications/Substitutions:
Six years of full time professional experience in data management and statistical analysis that primarily involve SQL and Tableau..(Substitution)
OR
Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in epidemiology, research methodology, statistics, statistical analysis, mathematics, economics, or closely related field;
AND
Two years of full time professional experience in data management and statistical analysis that primarily involve SQL and Tableau.(Minimum Qualifications)
OR
A master's or doctorate degree from an accredited college or university in epidemiology, research methodology, statistics, statistical analysis, mathematics, economics, or other field of study related to the work assignment may be substituted on a year-for-year basis.(Substitution)
NOTE: This experience must be substantiated within the Work Experience section of your application. "See Resume" will not be accepted. In addition, part-time work will be prorated. A copy of your transcript must be submitted at the time of application (Unofficial transcripts are acceptable.)

Preferred Qualifications and Essential Competencies:
The preferred experience, competencies and abilities are highly desirable for this position and will be considered in selecting the successful candidate:
Advanced experience and proficiency working with Tableau
Ability to articulate the components and complexities of data to a variety of audiences at different competency levels
Experience working with the SQL data analysis tools
Strong data science and relational database skills for manipulating, analyzing, and visualizing a wide variety of data sets
Understanding and experience with integrating variables and analyses between large datasets

Conditions of Employment:
A pre-employment criminal background check test will be conducted as part of the selection process. Felony convictions or conviction of crimes of moral turpitude or convictions of misdemeanors related to job duties may disqualify you from being considered for this position. Should your background check reveal any charges and convictions, it is your responsibility to provide the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment Human Resources office with an official disposition of any charges.
Must be willing and able to travel independently throughout the state 1 to 6 times per year including overnight stays.
This is a term-limited position and funding cannot be guaranteed beyond June 30, 2022. The incumbent in this position must be willing and able to resign on this date or when funds run out, whichever comes first.

Supplemental Information
A complete application packet must include:
A completed State of Colorado application.
A cover letter that describes how your experience aligns with the minimum and preferred qualifications of this position.
The Selection Process:
All applications that are received by the closing of this announcement will be reviewed against the Minimum Qualifications in this announcement. Candidates who meet the minimum qualifications proceed to the next step.
Colorado Revised Statutes require that state employees are hired and promoted based on merit and fitness through a comparative analysis process.
Part of, or all of, the comparative analysis for this position may be a structured application review, which involves a review of the information you submit in your application materials by Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) against the preferred qualifications.
A top group, up to six candidates, will be invited to schedule an interview with the hiring manager.
Appeal Rights: If you receive notice that you have been eliminated from consideration for the position or that as a result of no longer being considered, you were discriminated against, you may protest the action by filing an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the date you receive notice of the elimination. Also, if you wish to challenge the selection and comparative analysis process, you may file an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the receipt of notice or knowledge of the action you are challenging. If an applicant seeks to have an allegation of discrimination reviewed by the Board, that person must file an appeal (petition for hearing) within 10 days of the action or receipt of any final written selection decision. Refer to Chapters 4 and 8 of the State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, 4 CCR 801, for more information about the appeals process. The State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures are available at www.colorado.gov/spb. A standard appeal form is available at: www.colorado.gov/spb. If you appeal, your appeal must be submitted in writing on the official appeal form, signed by you or representative, and received at the following address within 10 days of your receipt of notice or knowledge of the action: Colorado State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director, Attn: Appeals Processing, 1525 Sherman Street, 4th Floor, Denver, CO 80203. Fax: 303-866-5038. Phone: 303-866-3300. The ten-day deadline and these appeal procedures also apply to all charges of discrimination.
E-Verify: CDPHE uses e-Verify, an Internet-based system, to confirm the eligibility of all newly hired employees to work in the United States. Learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities.

You must be legally eligible to work in the United States to be appointed to this position. CDPHE does not sponsor non-residents of the United States.

Key Nordson values include Integrity, Respect for People, Custom Passion, Energy, and Excellence. Key Competencies at this position include Learning Ability, Work Commitment/ Personal Responsibility, Communication, Problem-Solving, and Creating a trusting environment.

Preference will be given to candidates with IFS experience.

Department Summary:

DISH is a Fortune 250 company with more than $13 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.
Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.
We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. We’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.
Opportunity is here. We are DISH.

The Department of Health Care Policy & Financing (HCPF) oversees and operates Health First Colorado (Colorado's Medicaid Program), Child Health Plan Plus (CHP+), and other state public health programs for qualified Coloradans. Our mission is to improve health care equity, access and outcomes for the people we serve while saving Coloradans money on health care and driving value for Colorado.
We are committed to increasing the diversity of our staff and providing culturally responsive programs and services. Therefore, we encourage responses from people of diverse backgrounds and abilities.
We are looking for a Business and Operations Analyst to join our Office of Community Living team!
As part of the State of Colorado, HCPF offers a competitive benefits package:
PERA retirement benefits including PERA Defined Benefit Plan, PERA Defined Contribution Plan, plus 401K and 457 plans

Information about the Division:
 The Operations and Administration Division (Division) within the Office of Community Living (Office) acts as the service and support entity of the Office. The Division includes financial oversight, contract management, administrative support, and systems support for the day-to-day activities of the Office. The Finance Section within the Operations and Administration Division consists of various program areas: budget, finance, financial data analysis, financial compliance, contractual oversight, contractual compliance, operational support, and evaluation. These program area duties include: financial management of over 150 contracts annually for the Office; management and processing of all invoices for contracts and purchase orders for the Office; managing financial data in various information systems; directing and managing contract process changes; developing budget requests; managing and allocating newly appropriated community funding; management of twenty (20) Community Centered Board (CCB) contracts and budgets totaling approximately $25 million annually; management of twenty-four (24) Single Entry Point (SEP) contracts and budgets totaling approximately $38 million annually; financial and contractual reviews of the 20 CCBs to include the Family Support Services Program, State Supported Living Services Program, and OBRA Specialized Services Program; subrecipient monitoring activities for 20 CCBs and 24 SEPs.
The Systems Unit exists to provide technical and operational support to staff within the Office as this work pertains to the IT systems staff within the office and end users in the community leverage to meet the business goals of the Office. Work extends to drafting high level business requirements for systems changes to the Department’s Medicaid Management Information System, its Prior Authorization entry subsystem, and the electronic data warehouse. Staff research claims issues, assist with data management, and support decision making through data analytics. Staff act as leads on systems changes to the interChange and Bridge.
Staff within this unit also provide Business Analysis and Application oversight for the Department’s electronic case management tool, which is currently the Benefits Utilization System (BUS). The BUS is an online database provided by the Department to Case Management Agencies (CMAs) and contractors for documenting client assessments, service plans, and other information crucial to monitoring and compliance for Medicaid Long Term Services and Supports. The system allows end users to enter log notes, report critical health incidents, and perform reporting. Responsibilities include communication with the case management staff of 44 case management agencies, provisioning of user logins for the system, troubleshooting defects, and writing and approving test plans. This unit also supports Office-wide efforts to develop and roll out changes to existing and in-development systems used by the Office.

Description of Job
What you'll be doing:
Role is responsible for Business Analysis and system testing of IT platforms used by the Office, with work extending to supporting the implementation of new Commercial Off the Shelf (COTS) platforms to be leveraged by Office staff and contracted vendors.
Role works with program staff to identify and document business requirements for IT systems, coordinating closely with the Department Health Information Office staff to complete changes in impacted systems.
Act as Office-level point of contact for escalated systems concerns with the claims and case management systems, to include external stakeholders. Staff provides initial issue troubleshooting for Office staff related to claims processing and claims payment concerns. Role is responsible for working with Benefits and Case Management Staff to understand what needs to be changed, and working with the Health Information Office and the Department's fiscal agent to resolve. This involves the ability to research complex problems that may have root causes across the various data systems, and impact multiple parties. The role exists to ensure that providers are paid for services rendered.
Monitor metrics on Home and Community Based Services (HCBS) Prior Authorization creation and HCBS Waiver claims processing in the Department's claims processing system in order to identify and resolve agency-level and system-wide issues.This involves the ability to research complex problems that may have root causes across the various data systems, and impact multiple parties. The role exists to ensure that providers are paid for services rendered.
Provide training and orientation to HCBS direct service and case management agencies on State, federal and Medicaid rules, regulations and procedures as they apply to provider enrollment.
Support training material and process documentation updates and revisions relative to the Bridge.
Provide technical assistance to providers completing the ongoing Provider Revalidation process, including troubleshooting issues to ensure efficient identification of application errors and systems issues impeding successful enrollment.
Providing subject matter expertise to Department Health Information Office (HIO) staff and Fiscal Agent staff regarding operational impacts that may need to be considered as
changes.
Act as secondary point of contact for fraud referral and revocation of provider credentialing for Program Integrity and staff at the Colorado Department of Public Health & Environment. Work extends to the review and initial referral of complaints of potential fraudulent Medicaid waiver claims to Program Integrity as received from staff within the Office of Community Living and external stakeholders.
Provide technical assistance and support to Program Staff as short and long-term programmatic changes are proposed and implemented.
Draft Scope Change Requests and support Office-level oversight of all changes to the claims processing system implemented by the Department's Fiscal Agent through the Software Development Life Cycle.
Performs other duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal Rights
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in Business Administration, Computer Information Systems, Business Information Systems, Electronics/Communications, or a field of study related to the work assignment AND two years of professional experience as a business analyst, working with case management Health IT Systems.

Substitutions:
A combination of work experience in the occupational field or specialized subject area of the work assigned to the job, which provided the same kind, amount, and level of knowledge acquired in the required education, may be substituted on a year-for-year basis for the bachelor's degree.
A master's or doctorate degree from an accredited college or university in a field of study related to the work assignment may be substituted for the bachelor's degree and at the agency's discretion, one or two years of general experience respectively.
Preferred Qualifications
At least one year of professional experience supporting an electronic case management or Prior Authorization tool used by case managers doing service planning for clients receiving Long Term Care or other institutional-based care.
Two years of professional experience maintaining, troubleshooting, and performing system testing of large computer systems, preferably Medicaid claims processing systems or Medicaid case management systems.
Professional experience analyzing data obtained from user testing. Professional experience providing guidance to end-users. Professional experience resolving technical system issues.
DEFINITION OF PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE: Work that involves exercising discretion, analytical skill, judgment, personal accountability, and responsibility for creating, developing, integrating, applying, and sharing an organized body of knowledge that characteristically is uniquely acquired through an intense education or training regimen at a recognized college or university; equivalent to the curriculum requirements for a bachelor's or higher degree with major study in or pertinent to the specialized field; and continuously studied to explore, extend, and use additional discoveries, interpretations, and application and to improve data, materials, equipment, applications and methods.
CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT
All positions at HCPF are security sensitive positions and require that the individuals undergo a criminal record background check as a condition of employment.
Employees who have been disciplinary terminated, resigned in lieu of disciplinary termination, or negotiated their termination from the State of Colorado must disclose this information on the application.
APPEAL RIGHTS:

If you receive notice that you have been eliminated from consideration for the position, you may protest the action by filing an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the date you receive notice of the elimination.

Also, if you wish to challenge the selection and comparative analysis process, you may file an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the receipt of notice or knowledge of the action you are challenging.

Refer to Chapters 4 and 8 of the State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, 4 CCR 801, for more information about the appeals process. The State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures are available at spb.colorado.gov.

A standard appeal form is available at: spb.colorado.gov. If you appeal, your appeal must be submitted in writing on the official appeal form, signed by you or your representative, and received at the following address within 10 days of your receipt of notice or knowledge of the action: Colorado State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director, Attn: Appeals Processing, 1525 Sherman Street, 4th Floor, Denver, CO 80203. Fax: 303-866-5038. Phone: 303-866-3300. The ten-day deadline and these appeal procedures also apply to all charges of discrimination.

Supplemental Information
How to Apply (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY)
Please note that ONLY your State of Colorado job application will be reviewed during the initial screening; if you submit a resume and cover letter, they will be reviewed in later stages of the selection process. Therefore, it is paramount that you clearly describe all your relevant experience on the application itself. Applications left blank or marked "SEE RESUME" will not be considered.
Your application will be reviewed against the minimum qualifications for the position. If your application demonstrates that you meet the minimum qualifications, you will be invited to the comparative analysis process, which is described below.
Comparative Analysis Process
The comparative analysis process will consist primarily of a review of applications against the minimum and preferred qualifications of this position. Applications will be reviewed in comparison to all others in the applicant pool in order to identify a top group of candidates who may be invited for a final interview. Depending on the size of the applicant pool, additional selection processes may be utilized to identify a top group of candidates. Applicants will be notified of their status via email.
Failure to submit properly completed documents by the closing date will result in your application being rejected.

What we are about

Synaptic AP™ is a silver-tier Salesforce implementation consulting partner specializing in the development and deployment of secure, cloud-based enterprise applications on the Salesforce platform.

Since 2008, we've helped businesses solve critical operational challenges and accelerate growth across a variety of complex verticals. Our mission is to help clients get the most out of their Salesforce investment with world-class professional services and applications. Join us. We love our team and our customers.

With passion and innovation embedded in our DNA, we go out of our way to encourage our employees to share new ideas and feedback on a regular basis.

Who you are

As a successful, team-centric professional, you're a strong oral and written communicator who is comfortable presenting to groups. You have a keen attention to detail and are exceptionally good at identifying inconsistencies and flaws. You can juggle several balls and not lose track of the little things. You're looking for a role with substantial opportunities to learn, grow, and take on more (the good news is, we have that stuff in spades!).

What you will do

The Business Analyst's primary responsibility is to understand the needs of the customer. The Business Analyst is expected to conduct requirements gathering meetings, ensure adherence to the project scope, support the solution design, help implement the design, test the system, and make sure the solution is maintained. The Business Analyst is also expected to be knowledgeable about the Salesforce environment (understanding capabilities and limitations) and actively participate in the solution development. This position requires the ability to perform the following:

Requirements Analysis: conduct requirements gathering sessions to elicit, define and document detailed business and technical requirements
Process Design: develop user stories and to-be process flows to support the design and development of Salesforce solutions
Solution Design: work closely with the Solution Architect or Technical Architect to explain the requirements and ensure the design meets all of the identified requirements
Solution Configuration: complete configuration/customization tasks using Salesforce's click configuration framework (no coding capability required)
Quality Assurance: prepare and execute QA scripts, track QA process from beginning to end
End User Training: prepare end user training materials customized for each project, deliver training to Client Trainers and/or end users.
Change Management: Identify and document how business processes impacted by each project will change. Develop guidance to prepare workforce for upcoming system launch

The Business Analyst plays a critical role in Synaptic's success of product delivery and client satisfaction and therefore must consistently strive to meet or exceed our clients' expectations.

Skills and experience you need to be successful

Related Bachelor's degree
1+ years of experience as a Business Analyst focused on delivering enterprise software solutions
Excellent written and oral communication, presentation, and customer service skills
Experience soliciting, gathering, and analyzing user input and requirements
Experience documenting user stories and creating process flow diagrams
Experience documenting requirements and communicating with a technical team
Hands on experience configuring Salesforce including workflows, validation rules and security controls
Ability to manage efforts across multiple projects
Be a team player with strong interpersonal skills

Skills that would be a bonus

Current Salesforce Consultant certification (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, etc.). A Consultant certification will be required within the first 90 days of employment
Experience with Agile/Scrum
Experience with Jira, Confluence, Smartsheet, LucidChart, and mind mapping software
Experience with change management

Location

This position is based in either of our offices in Annapolis, MD and Stuart, FL or remote. 10-20% travel may be required.

We have
An amazing team focused on doing #Whateverittakes to help our clients and teammates be successful
A calling to innovate and improve every day
A competitive benefits and compensation package
Room for rapid growth and an emphasis on talent development
A fun, casual team environment with cool co-workers who will make you feel like you are an important part of our team, engage you in developing new solutions to challenging problems, and help you leverage your strengths to make all of us better!
A great benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, AD&D and Life Insurance coverage, employer paid short term disability coverage, wellness initiatives, and more!
Competitive Paid Time Off (PTO) package that includes time in service increases, Volunteer Time Off (VTO), 7 Holidays, and flexible work schedule

FirstBank Lubbock Bancshares began with the vision of one man, Barry Orr, and a promise. Barry promised his wife and friends that he would start a bank that would become profitable through relationships, hard work and determination. "It is our goal to be the BEST community bank in the Lubbock area," states Barry Orr, Chairman & CEO. "We knew we could help build a better Lubbock by serving the needs of customers our way."
The Commercial Business Analyst Team Lead is responsible for partnering with front-line leaders to ensure the processes, performance, and reporting for Commercial Banking support at bank subsidiaries of Heartland Financial USA, Inc. (the “Company”), meets the standards required to meet the goals of the banks and business line. In addition, the Commercial Business Analyst Team Lead manages the Commercial Banking analysis and effectiveness reporting function outside the sales arena.
PRIMARY & ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Manages the Company’s Commercial Banking loan support function with the support of Commercial Banking loan support supervisors at the bank level.

a. Identifies opportunities and develops processes to improve efficiency of the Commercial loan support function.

b. Ensures consistent accountability standards for the support function.

c. Ensures clear definition and communication of responsibilities and gearing ratios for the support function.

2. Conducts analysis of commercial banking processes across the Company; identifies ways to improve and standardize processes; and manages other Commercial Banking Analyst(s) who support this responsibility.

3. Oversees business management reporting for Commercial Banking outside the sales arena.

a. High level summaries of the performance of all business lines under Commercial Banking – Treasury Management, Retirement Plan Services, Commercial Card, Commercial Lending.

b. Individual Commercial Banker portfolio analysis

c. Bank-level portfolio analysis.

4. Demonstrates the ability to successfully learn and support the credit administration support function for the specialty vertical function within Commercial Banking through targeted activity as assigned.

5. Supports the Heartland Commercial Banking team on execution of day-to-day initiatives for identified lines of business

6. Supports the reporting/analytics, marketing and sales enablement, project management, and operational administrative services

7. Assists with providing and maintaining tools to assist leaders in translating the Commercial Banking vision into business objectives, strategies and financial expectations

8. Assists with M&A due diligence and any subsequent acquisition integration as it relates to Commercial Banking.

9. Helps identify and maintain a prioritized listing of high impact, cross-functional projects which focus on process, sales enablement and data flow improvements. Serves as project lead on assigned projects.

10. Assists with the implementation of policies and procedures to achieve Commercial Banking tactical and strategic business goals.

11. Identifies business challenges and opportunities for improvement.

12. Works closely with colleagues across Heartland including: Technology, Marketing, Operations, Finance, Product and others to drive improvement in quality, volume, and profitability.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Supervises and coaches Commercial Banking Analysts

2. Works with Heartland’s recruitment team to hire the most qualified and talented individuals to fill open positions for the function.

3. Provides information and on-going feedback to department staff regarding expectations and performance. Addresses performance issues in a timely manner.

4. Prepares and conducts annual performance reviews and professional development discussions.
REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
1. 3-5 years’ experience assessing data, leading to key considerations and proposing recommendations

2. Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Finance, or related field.

3. 3-5 years of commercial banking, treasury management and/or commercial card experience preferred

4. Prior management experience preferred

5. Ability to leverage the capabilities of a high-performing team, as well as business partners across the enterprise.

6. Excellent sales and thorough knowledge of operational processes

7. Good negotiating skills to work with customers, banks and service providers to identify/create service options that work and add value to the customer

8. Strong expertise in secondary credit risk management and audit controls

9. Current understanding of regulatory compliance issues relating to banking

10. General understanding of commercial credit policy. Strong working knowledge within the banking industry, treasury operations, accounting and corresponding banking

11. Strong executive communication skills both oral and written, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills

12. Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access) and database software.

Schedule Weekly Hours:
40
Time Type:
Full time

job_title: Senior Director, Technology and Business Intelligence
description: CompanyAt Intercare, our mission is to empower families through exceptional care. Intercare Therapy is an autism services health care company that was founded in 1979 and is growing rapidly, with almost 800 employees spread throughout twelve offices across five states. We serve almost 900 individuals of all ages who are diagnosed with autism and/or related disorders, and both our clinical and business operations adhere to learning and behavior management principles based on the science of applied behavior analysis (ABA).At Intercare, we focus on culture, great clinical work, integrity, communication, and adaptability. We prioritize staff satisfaction and are proud to be the highest rated established ABA organization on Glassdoor.Position summaryAs Intercare continues to pursue our mission and grow into new markets, we are looking to expand our Technology Team and position ourselves for rapid growth and scalability.We are seeking a Senior Director, Technology and Business Intelligence. You will be responsible for the oversight, growth, development and professional management of Intercare’s crucial Technology functions: IT Infrastructure, Business Intelligence and Analytics.
