Company Overview:Age of Learning is a leading education technology innovator based in Glendale, California, with a talented team of more than 600 individuals comprised of nationally-renowned educators, curriculum experts, developers, artists, writers, designers, engineers, producers, product managers, analysts and marketing experts! Together we develop engaging, effective digital learning technology and content to help children build a strong academic foundation for lifelong success.  Our flagship product ABCmouse.com Early Learning Academy® is a comprehensive online curriculum and the #1 digital learning product for young children. To-date, more than 30 million children worldwide have completed over 8 billion Learning Activities on ABCmouse. We recently launched Adventure Academy, the first massively multiplayer online (MMO) game designed specifically to help elementary- and middle-school-aged children learn. It features thousands of engaging Learning Activities—including minigames, books, original animated and live action series, and more—in a fun and safe virtual world. Other Age of Learning programs include immersive English language learning products for children in China and Japan; ReadingIQ, a digital library and literacy platform; and a groundbreaking personalized, adaptive digital learning system that individualizes math instruction for every child through AI-driven technology. We are committed to helping all children succeed. We provide our educational programs at no cost to teachers, Head Start programs, public libraries, and other community organizations, and have served millions of children through these initiatives. We recently established the Age of Learning Foundation to expand this work globally. As we expand our global reach and increase the educational impact of our programs, we’re looking for passionate, ambitious, and collaborative leaders to become a part of our growing team.Summary:We are looking for two experienced (mid to Senior) Product Analysts or Data Scientists who will work on our centralized Data & Analytics team and collaborate closely with one of the following teams: Adventure Academy or International Products. You will bring to light key data insights that drive decisions for our learning software and games, delighting kids and parents alike. You have a passion for video games and education. You are a rare breed of analytics powerhouse and business-savvy — a proactive, intellectually curious, and entrepreneurial Product Analyst, who will own and deliver in-depth analyses of large-scale data problems to influence numerous aspects of business performance. You will have a strong impact in influencing product management and senior executives through actionable business/roadmap recommendations.  Contribution will come in the form of defining data capture requirements, verifying data integrity, data manipulation, business monitoring, data visualization, and in-depth analyses. Responsibilities: You willPartner closely with product stakeholders to solve key product challengesConduct product analyses to understand how user behavior impacts KPIs, such as retention and long-term valueCreate, report, and interpret key metrics to assess performance, measure the impact of strategic initiatives and identify ways to grow revenue and reduce costsDevelop statistical analyses to understand customer behavior and product performanceCreate beautiful and informative automated/real-time dashboards and visualizationsDrive A/B and multivariate testing strategy and implementation across desktop and mobile platforms to inform product strategy, engagement, retention, lifetime value, product and content recommendations, and personalized experiencesIdentify actionable insights that positively affect both company revenue and learning outcomes for childrenCommunicate results to technical and non-technical stakeholdersDrive data capture and data integrity requirements; partner with product and engineering teams so that the right data is capturedMaintain a vigilant eye on data qualityMaintain knowledge of competitive and related productsRequired Qualifications: 2+ years in an analytical/product-focused role; B2C digital products preferred; video game experience strongly preferred for Adventure Academy role Strong analytical and reporting skillsFluent in complex SQL queries on big data setsFluent in Tableau and Excel (Additional data visualization capabilities a plus) Able to manipulate and explore data, perform analysis and create visualizations using R or PythonComfortable defining analytics architecture that meets product management requirementsCollaborative problem-solving skills with an entrepreneurial attitude and results-oriented mindsetBachelor's or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., analytics, statistics, applied math, data science, economics or computer science); OR if no quantitative degree, 2-4 additional years related experience and/or training Experience with testing and optimization a plus, ideally in a digital environmentAge of Learning currently provides: • 90% - 100% of health and welfare benefit premiums• A 401(k) program with employer match• 15 paid vacation days plus 11 observed national paid holidays• Team bonding events and a highly collaborative environment• Commitment to Equal Opportunity Employment in addition to an inclusive and supportive company culture • Access to our internal DEI Task Force that focuses on ensuring our products represent all children on a global scale• Opportunities for professional growth through professional learning and development programs • A temporary 100% remote work environment, due to COVID restrictions, to help ensure the safety of our employees • Monthly internet stipend provided due to temporary remote work environment

The Viterbi School of Engineering seeks to recruit an adaptable, dependable Budget/Business Analyst to support core financial operations during a period of transformative change. The Budget/Business Analyst is a critical staff role within the finance team, performing a combination of duties related to monitoring, reconciling, analyzing, and reporting on budget activity across the Viterbi School. The BBA provides consultative services and performs administrative duties as needed to support the finance team and the Viterbi School more broadly.The Budget/Business Analyst supports overall financial functions at the Viterbi School, provide supporting services across 350 full time faculty (tenure, research and teaching), 350 full time staff, 60 postdoctoral scholars, and more than 2000 Student Workers across eight academic departments, several academic programs, and various administrative units. The USC Viterbi School is committed to increasing diversity of its staff and welcomes applications from women, African Americans, Hispanic Americans, Native Americans, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.The specific accountabilities of this role include, but are not limited to:Supports Accounting/Finance Supervisor and our Chief Financial Officer in all aspects of financial management and reporting across the Viterbi School.Administers assigned budgets. Monitors actual income and expense and develops projections in order to authorize or extend financial commitments. Analyzes current performance to plan. Identifies and researches variances and trends and brings to the attention of financial leadership for discussion and resolution. Projects future budget performance based on knowledge of assigned operations.Assists in tracking and management relating to the School’s Commitments, Central Obligations, and Relocations accounts. Tracks and distributes School's royalty payments. Researches and resolves gift account and endowment account issues.Coordinates department purchasing and invoice processing for payments. Works with individuals and companies to establish new vendor accounts and set-up vendors as Independent Contracts as needed in coordinator with Viterbi HR.Coordinates regular audit of school’s Equipment Inventory. Oversees, tracks, and analyzes School’s photocopy demand; tracks equipment fleet, maintains records, and process payments.Coordinates School’s Mobile Communications Authorizations; conducts annual review, maintains records, and prepare payroll allowances.Assists with year-end closing activities for CAM and Structures CORE labs.Assists in preparation of periodic financial reports for internal and/or external use as needed.Provides high quality service and consultation to internal and external clients regarding university financial policies as well as procedures advocating school-applicable guidelines and requirements.Processes system-access requests for other staff as needed.Ensures confidentiality and controls access to sensitive information such as faculty or staff personnel files.Performs other duties as assigned.JOB QUALIFICATIONS:Minimum Education: Bachelor's degree; combined experience/education as substitute for minimum educationMinimum Experience: 1 yearsMinimum Field of Expertise: Business administration, accounting or related degree and budget experience including knowledge of government and fund accounting. Strong computer skills with use of automated spreadsheets.Preferred Education: Bachelor's degreePreferred Experience: 2 yearsPreferred Field of Expertise: University budget experience and knowledge of university financial systems.For your application to be considered complete, please upload both a Cover Letter and a current resume or CV..

At WelbeHealth, our vision is a world where every human being participates in our culture through their final days. To make this vision a reality, we provide integrated medical and social services to our most vulnerable seniors, helping to unlock their full potential. We are looking for team members who are energized by working in diverse teams toward our shared purpose, who are eager to drive groundbreaking innovation, and who will interact with those we serve and those who serve them in a spirit of understanding and compassion. The WelbeHealth PACE (Program of All-Inclusive Care for the Elderly) programs in California are thriving and quickly growing. The program serves as our patients' health insurer and directly provides comprehensive primary care and social services to keep them living safely in the community.

The Business Analyst is responsible for managing, organizing, and communicating launch status of multiple new care programs in development stage across finance, strategy, regulatory, real estate, hiring and operations domains in support of our mission to bring services to seniors in need throughout the country. This includes researching options for new care programs both physical and virtual and conducting analyses based on complex data sets to facilitate senior leadership decision meetings. The Business Analyst will facilitate senior leadership interdisciplinary meetings and collaborate effectively with colleagues and stakeholders to promote the WelbeHealth values, team culture and mission.

What you'll do:

Interdisciplinary project management of strategy, finance, regulatory, hiring, operations, marketing and outreach to ensure projects stay on track and on time
Research real estate opportunities including on-site visits
Combine interdisciplinary input from finance, regulatory, and other departments into concise business cases, recommendations, and presentations making go/no-go decisions on specific opportunities compared to others
Collaborate with all departments to assure coordination in meeting preparation, and drive effective meeting discussions and decisions, including holding team accountable for follow-up actions
Create and maintain a tracker of all programs in development stage that allows visibility on status, timing, and bottlenecks by functional area

Why you'll love working at WelbeHealth:

You'll play a critical role in bringing the ground-breaking WelbeHealth PACE model of care to scale, providing much needed services to a vulnerable population

Position Overview

We are looking for an ERP business systems analyst to join our Information Systems team at Romeo Power to lead our Plex process deployments, enhancements, and interfacing with all other critical business systems. You will help to enhance our current platform both natively and through integrations throughout our infrastructure to meet the needs of our growing battery engineering company. The selected candidate must be well versed with how all enhancements have cross-functional impacts, both natively within the ERP platform and throughout interconnected critical systems, Thus, a focus on and experience with processes for thoroughly planned deployments with proper validation, documentation, and validation is critical.

Key Roles and Responsibilities

Collaborate with business partners to assess legacy processes, data and system capabilities to help drive alignment to and adoption of new ERP standards.
Partner with business leaders on options to solve business process gaps including business requirements and solution options.
Design efficient technical workflows that match business process with capabilities of the ERP and other systems.
Lead the functional design process for complex solutions.
Configure business applications based on business requirements and functional design documents.
Partner with peers in the implementation and maintenance of cross functional solutions.
Develop and execute plans for testing and training of the new system.
Maintain system documentation and user training material.
Partner with support team members to effectively deliver product changes and provide escalated support assistance as required.

 Basic Qualifications

BS in a MIS or related degree program with relevant business experience preferably in a heavy manufacturing environment.
5+ years working as a business analyst with established ERPs, with an emphasis on cloud-based services.
1-3 years experience with Plex ERP
1+ years experience with Plex UX is a plus
Must have strong analytical skills and ability to think strategically.
Comfortability working closely with a cross-functional business units and key stakeholders at every level of the organization.
Excellent management and organization skills to be able to manage multiple deadlines and projects simultaneously.
Demonstrated proficiency working with developers to integrate software with third party applications.
Strong written and verbal communications skills.
Experience using SQL is a plus.

We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. All individuals, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply.

Romeo Power is a startup company located in Vernon, CA. just south of Downtown L.A. We design, and manufacture EV battery technology for various electric mobility platforms. Several of our talented staff come from Tesla, SpaceX, Faraday Future, Karma and other known unique and powerful companies. We are a group of highly-motivated and extremely talented staff that is set on launching products that will revolutionize the EV battery industry in power density.

Job Description:

The primary objective of the BSA, Finance & Sales is to support the Finance and Sales organizations by analyzing and improving the efficiency of the Company’s ERP system, maximizing system capabilities. This position will evaluate and understand business problems and translate needs into solutions, making recommendations to Leadership on matters that have significant profitability and efficiency ramifications.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Upgrading and supporting the ERP system on premise and cloud-based systems, ensuring that systems operate reliably and efficiently in a secure environment, product lifecycle management, performing regression testing, responding to audits, and guiding continuous improvement initiatives. Facilitating training for users on updates and changes, as well as introductory training for new users. Acting as a conduit to the Finance and Sales Teams for utilizing the system to troubleshoot issues and implement counter measures. This role will liaise with the Subject Matter Experts within the Finance and Sales departments to resolve complex or emergent operational problems and partner with process owners to develop strategies, objectives and roadmaps for applications that are in alignment with functional department goals. Providing general support to end-users, this role will triage issues and concerns, conducting root cause analysis to identify and implement workarounds, countermeasures, and long-term solutions in partnership with the business.

In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as 'Personal Cell' or 'Cellular' in the contact information of your application.At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.Consumer and Small Business Banking (CSBB) is at the center of our efforts to rebuild trust and transform the way we serve our customers and clients. The CSBB organization is focused on innovating and transforming our business with the customer at the center, better enabling customers to engage with us how, when, and wherever they choose through a broad suite of financial products and services. While we are pleased to be an industry leader in many consumer and small business areas, including retail deposits, debit card transaction and purchase volume, and small business lending, our primary goal is delivering for our customers. Our market positions are an outcome of great work by employees who are committed to serving our customers. We want to build a strong value proposition for key consumer and small business segments by identifying gaps and opportunities and building capabilities to transform how we engage customers and deliver advice.The Chief Customer Office works across the CSBB, Consumer Lending, and Wealth and Investment Management lines of business to develop coordinated strategies for growth in each of Wells Fargo's customer segments. The Marketing Operations Analyst at Conductor based in our NYC Headquarters, will focus on working closely with the sales and marketing teams to build, execute, maintain and analyze marketing automation programs that drives new business and increases customer renewals. This role will be responsible for creating scalable processes for our organization that ensure standard methodologies in lead generation and database management. This role will report to the Director, Marketing Operations.

A day in the life will look like..:

Support essential marketing operations initiatives including building/executing campaigns, managing the lead lifecycle, lead scoring, lead nurturing, segmentation and data cleansing.
Build and test marketing campaign assets including emails, landing pages and forms
Develop, monitor, test and optimize Marketo programs for all stages of the marketing and sales funnels.
Manage project timelines, ensuring that all activities occur as planned and that campaigns are executed on time, from scheduling to design, production and distribution.
Develop and maintain marketing operations processes and documentation to support communication and efficiency across the marketing team
Uncover inaccuracies or inefficiencies with data or processes and then develop and implement solutions that scale
Focus on automation of manual tasks and on ways to fill the gaps in our technology stack
Perform day-to-day system maintenance and configuration of Marketo, driving improvements and employing best practices.
Iterate with key stakeholders to improve and maintain dashboards and accurate pipeline measurement and sourcing
Fulfill ad-hoc reporting requests for global marketing organization and identify opportunities for improved reporting

We're excited if you have..:

Preferably at least one year of experience in Marketing Operations or a similar role
Strong experience using marketing automation and CRM software (Marketo and Salesforce strongly preferred)
Practical Email Marketing experience, including drip sequences, operational emails, and automated triggers
Naturally analytical, but have an interest in thinking through the creative side of marketing activities and campaigns
Ability to work cross-functionally with sales, marketing, customer success, and product teams to translate needs into effective programs
Empower team members with reporting on KPIs, overall performance and key findings
Proven track record to pick up new technical skills quickly
Strong project/program management skills; must have the ability to optimally multi-task
Strong analytical ability, attention to detail and organizational/time management skills
understanding of Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets
Preferable experience in B2B SaaS
Comfortable in the fast-paced, high growth environment of a startup
Basic CSS and HTML understanding a plus

As a Sales Analyst at Conductor based in our NYC Headquarters, you will provide critical support across the organization. The Revenue Operations team is responsible for empowering our market facing teams with the tools and data needed to continue our organization's successful growth. This role will report to the Sr. Manager, Revenue Operations.

A day in the life..:

Manage contract order form process
Provide custom order form edits within sales systems
Ensure Customer & Prospect Data Cleanliness to ensure accurate reporting
Perform regular quality audits to ensure contract data is accurate
Assist in creating and updating revenue team's and individual's dashboards
Subject Matter Expert on all things Salesforce and assist with new hire trainings
Maintain data accuracy across all accounts, contacts & opportunity fields in Salesforce
Coordinate with data science team to ensure consistent refresh of 3rd party data
Track and analyze key metrics ensuring timeliness, completeness and accuracy of reporting
Develop and deliver reporting to support initiatives and day-to-day operations

We're excited if you..:

Preferably at least 1 year of experience or prior internships working within Sales or Sales Operations preferably within a SaaS business
Familiarity with Salesforce or similar CRM applications.
Strong analytical ability, attention to detail and organizational/time management skills
Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage critical situations
Proactive and reliable; driven to achieve team goals
Demonstrate a hustle attitude with persistent approach
Ability to track a multitude of simultaneous projects
Matured sense of tact and conflict resolution
Excellent interpersonal and communication & presentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively cross lines of business, work independently, and take initiative when appropriate
Desired prior experience using DocuSign, Adobe Pro a plus
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Google Suite with strong Excel Skills
Comfortable in the fast-paced, high growth environment of a startup

The Business Analytics Ld Analyst is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.

Responsibilities:

Gathers operational data from various cross functional stakeholders to examine past business performanceIdentifies data patterns & trends, and provides insights to enhance business decision making capability in business planning, process improvement, solution assessment etc.Recommends actions for future developments & strategic business opportunities, as well as enhancements to operational policiesMay be involved in exploratory data analysis, confirmatory data analysis and/or qualitative analysisTranslate data into consumer or customer behavioral insights to drive targeting and segmentation strategies, and communicate clearly and effectively to business partners and senior leaders all findingsContinuously improve processes and strategies by exploring and evaluating new data sources, tools, and capabilitiesWork closely with internal and external business partners in building, implementing, tracking and improving decision strategiesAppropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications:

6-10 years of experienceExperience as an Operations Research Analyst, Analytics Manager, Strategic Business Analyst or related position performing quantitative analytics supporting financial servicesExperience analyzing large datasets; applying mathematical, statistical and quantitative analysis techniques to perform complex analyses and data mining

Education:

Bachelors/University degree, Masters degree preferred

This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

The ultimate source for official answers about a business online should be the business itself. However, when consumers ask questions on company websites, too often they are left in the dark with wrong answers. Yext (NYSE: YEXT), the Search Experience Cloud, solves this problem by organizing a business's facts so it can provide official answers to consumer questions — wherever people search. Starting with the company website, then extending across search engines and voice assistants, businesses around the world, like Taco Bell, Marriott, and Jaguar Land Rover—as well as organizations like the U.S. State Department—trust Yext to radically improve the search experience on their websites and across the entire search ecosystem.Yext is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to join the FP&A team that will provide technical and creative skills to solve both data and system challenges. The role will be responsible for supporting the administration and development of the Anaplan platform as well as driving data and process improvement initiatives for the department.Reporting to the Director of Finance Analytics and Enablement, the successful candidate will be able to think out of the box and always be thinking strategically to find solutions. From developing models, to integrating data, to surfacing key information in Tableau, this role has the opportunity to make an impact and the freedom to get creative.We're looking for someone that's results oriented, creative and curious, has outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, attention to detail, and is able to manage projects cross functionally.What You'll DoAdminister and support the Anaplan platformConfigure, maintain and update Anaplan data flows, users, lists, modules, dashboards, settings to support daily operations and new initiativesOwn and assist processes in the forecasting and planning cyclesProvide ongoing production support to the end users regarding application functionality and data integrityLead requirements gathering sessions, create proof of concepts, and end-to-end development, and run UAT sessions for future model enhancements and projectsParticipate in managing the backlogs and long term commitments to deliver a cohesive Anaplan platform for all end-usersSupport operational data projects to enhance business and IT processes across the finance organization and performance trackingManage multiple projects and diverse, cross-functional project teams simultaneously, while successfully driving projects and tasks to completionWhat You HaveBachelor's degree or similar college level education in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or similar field3-5 years experience in FP&A, Accounting, IT, Consulting, or related roles. Experience in a high growth technology company is a plus.Required administration and development experience of a financial modeling system such as Anaplan, Adaptive Planning, Planful, or similar.Understanding of three statement financial modeling and accounting principlesHave a good understanding of key business and finance functions (GL close process, FP&A, Treasury, Revenue, etc).SQL and Tableau skills a plusOrganized with the ability to work on and manage multiple projects within tight timelinesExcellent analytical skills, strong proficiency in financial modeling, attention to detailTeam player with excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skillsYext is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, genetics, sex, pregnancy or childbirth, sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity or nonbinary or nonconformity and/or status as a trans individual), age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, marital, parental and/or familial status, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.#LI-JM1

job_title: CTI Business Infrastructure & Business Project Management Analyst
description:
S No. 13.This position is a project coordinator role for the CTI Analytics team for Business initiatives and Regulatory requirements. The CTI business has a large number of initiatives that require a skilled person to insure the implementation of the projects. These projects cross all sections of the CTI Business including the Rates, MBS, FX, and Capital Markets. The projects can span all aspects of the business from P&L, Risk, Pricing, Valuation, Products, Operations, Accounting, Legal and Compliance.

Job Requirements

The project coordinator role requires strong communication skills with the ability to distill complex information into simple presentations. The core responsibility for this role will be to assist and coordinate multiple business projects that require the implementation of system and business process changes and the installation of technical (system) and/or operational (procedural) change.

Responsibilities:

Work closely with Business, Finance, and Technology partners to understand business requirementsWriting of Project Charters, BRDs & Test PlansParticipate in weekly working group meetings with stakeholders across CTI trading desks, product control, risk, operations & technologyData analysis to support various stages of a projectClear summarizing of key discussion points and action items upon meeting closurePartnering with accountable participants to ensure prompt follow-ups are completedTracking general progress and escalating all risks and issues on a daily basis

Qualifications:

Minimum Bachelors Degree required. Graduate level degree a plus.3 - 5 years of experience within project management or financial services or consultingSignificant intellectual curiosity and desire to learn how Citi Treasury functionsSuperior attention to detail and diligence sufficient to withstand scrutiny of a senior audienceStrong team collaborator and partnering skills

job_title: IT Business Partnering, Small Molecule Drug Discovery
description: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.Director, IT Business Partnering, Small Molecule Drug Discovery is accountable for the effective delivery of IT capabilities and services broadly supporting the Small Molecule Drug Discovery organization. This accountability is driven via two distinct but related responsibilities; first, by acting as the direct manager of a team of Business Analysts who flexibly resource key IT initiatives in conjunction with IT Business Partners aligned directly to business functions; and secondly via ownership of key strategic themes and initiatives within Small Molecule Drug Discovery that cross functional boundaries. This is a senior role partnering with the Small Molecule Drug Discovery leadership team to define and drive digital capabilities to meet specific strategic needs.ResponsibilitiesDirector, IT Business Partnering, Small Molecule Drug Discovery is accountable for the effective delivery of IT capabilities and services broadly supporting the Small Molecule Drug Discovery organization. This accountability is driven via two distinct but related responsibilities; first, by acting as the direct manager of a team of Business Analysts who flexibly resource key IT initiatives in conjunction with IT Business Partners aligned directly to business functions; and secondly via ownership of key strategic themes and initiatives within Small Molecule Drug Discovery that cross functional boundaries. This is a senior role partnering with the Small Molecule Drug Discovery leadership team to define and drive digital capabilities to meet specific strategic needs.Provides strong and supportive management for a team of scientifically-minded IT Business AnalystsEstablishes and maintains a learning culture while demonstrating a passion for skillset development within Business Relationship Management, Business Analysis, and the Small Molecule Drug Discovery scientific domain.Partners with IT Business Partner peers within IT for Small Molecule Drug Discovery to effectively and flexibly resource the broad portfolio of Small Molecule Drug Discovery digital capability investments.Develops and coaches team members to achieve and exceed short-term objectives, to support their long-term career development, and to sustain an internal pipeline of talent for the future. Leverages the BMS Values to build a compelling team culture.Provides domain leadershipOwns the IT strategy: Drives the development of realistic and actionable multi-year strategic digital capability roadmaps, informed and prioritized by both business and IT in an enterprise context. Prioritizes digital capability investments appropriately and is jointly accountable for budget management.Develops compelling business cases: Leads the prioritization and development of strong and clear business cases for digital capability investments in support of the roadmap and aligned with the platform strategy. Defines, measures, & achieves business outcomes for highest value digital capabilities.Brings an external view: Actively maintains awareness of external drivers in the business domain and relevant technology trends, and brings new ideas.Knows what value looks like: Understands where BMS should be competitively differentiated through technology, translates business needs into specific business requirements, sees realistic opportunities for IT to add more value, and balances this with a pragmatic understanding of “fitness for purpose”.Leverages the matrix to drive portfolio executionDemonstrates Matrix leadership by ensuring that all IT functions are successful in their delivery of services to Small Molecule Drug Discovery.Empowers delivery teams: Understands IT business partner accountabilities throughout the portfolio lifecycle, and builds empowered and trusting partnerships with IT delivery team members at all levels.Constructively advocates for value: Ensures delivery teams understand how to make the right trade-offs between speed, quality and cost. Connects the business stakeholders with the broader IT services. Ensures value is being captured from the entire lifecycle of the investment (from launch through retirement).Shows good judgement in communication: Communicates successes and issues accurately, urgently, and to the right audience, and takes accountability for ensuring effective management of expectations with business leaders.Boldly acts with urgency: Shows courage, tenacity and respect to provoke uncomfortable conversations in order to remove roadblocks to value delivery.Desired ExperienceB.S., M.S., or Ph.D in a relevant scientific or technical domainSeasoned direct and matrix management skills, with a particular emphasis on energizing and developing talent.Relevant experience with resourcing a complex digital capability portfolio.Relevant expertise in the application of IT capabilities to drive business value in a Research & Early Development domain.Track record of leading the analysis of complex and ambiguous business needs, and integrating those needs into compelling and actionable strategic plans and investment business cases with broad reach and impact.Track record of delivering high-value digital capability projects within timelines and budget.Demonstrated commitment to creative thinking and application of innovative technologies within a relevant scientific domain.Proven ability to drive efficiencies and strategic synergies across IT functions and platforms.Strong collaboration, communication and presentation skills.Working knowledge of agile methodologies applied to SDLC and IT servicesAround the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.Job CategoryMulesoft - Customer Success GroupJob DetailsMuleSoft’s Professional Services team works across every technology to deliver solutions to customers in every industry. As a Business Systems Analyst (BSA) on our Services team, you will play a key role in our Professional Services practice growth. MuleSoft is the leader in implementing the application network by connecting data, devices and applications and we are pursuing people passionate about integration that enables digital transformation.As a BSA, you will be responsible for understanding client’s needs in order to determine how MuleSoft’s platform addresses the business problem at hand. BSA will be responsible for elicitation and documentation of integration requirements that are aligned with MuleSoft's design, architecture and implementation. Furthermore, BSA will be working closely with Solution Architects (SA) and Delivery Managers (DM) to ensure that provided requirements are sufficient to assess level of effort and design solutions for use cases in scope.Below are some of the responsibilities that you will carry out in your role as BSA:Gain understanding of client's environment and vision leveraging expertise around industry and business demandUnderstand business process and use cases and translate them into integration solutionElicit integration requirements with SA’s inputFacilitate requirements walkthroughDocument requirements and system interfaces in easily consumable formatSupport requirement prioritization and scope alignmentFacilitate sign-off to ensure alignment and obtain confirmation of integration requirementsWork with DM to align solution vision to KPIs and corresponding metricsPlay a key role in functional testing of the solution, making sure the KPIs and metrics are achieved.What You’ll AchieveFirst 3 monthsComplete Mulesoft training including our Mulesoft products, Catalyst methodologies for Services implementations and services offeringsComplete BSA training, including Facilitation, Requirements Overview, and Integration Requirements for API-LedComplete training to understand the role of each Mulesoft team included in Services engagements - DescriptionFirst Eagle Investment Management is an independent, privately-owned investment management firm headquartered in New York with approximately $101 billion* in assets under management. Dedicated to providing prudent stewardship of client assets, the firm focuses on active, fundamental and benchmark-agnostic investing, with a strong emphasis on downside protection. Over a long history dating back to 1864, First Eagle has helped its clients avoid permanent impairment of capital and earn attractive returns through widely varied economic cycles—a tradition that is central to its mission today. The firm’s investment capabilities include equity, fixed income, alternative credit, and multi-asset strategies.As of June 30, 2020 First Eagle is seeking a Business Analyst to be part of the Applications and Systems Development team supporting core Applications and technology requirements for the entire Firm. As part of a highly visible team, this role requires excellent teamwork, technical, analytical, and communication skills to perform frontline support for business users. Primary Responsibilities:Bridging the gap between IT and the business using data analytics to assess processes, determine requirements and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to executives and stakeholders.Design solutions that are technologically feasible, financially and functionally reasonable.Front line support of traders and operations users assisting in security setup, allocations, post trade issues, gathering reporting and workflow enhancement requests.Participation in extensive testing of applications, reports, workflows and application software upgrades or patch releases.Document and maintain all system components at Disaster Recovery Site and actively participate in the building, testing and maintenance of the Disaster Recovery process.Maintain documentation for technical systems, processes and test scripts.Comply with best practices in existing testing and release management.Support MS SQL tables, views and stored procedures. Qualifications:7+ years of related experience in financial services domain.Relational database programming skills required; strong Microsoft SQL knowledge.Experience with Data Warehouse and Business intelligence tools is required.Experience with OMS (preferably Charles River), Accounting Software (preferably Geneva) and Reconciliation applications is preferred.Experience working on UNIX or windows platforms.Experience with Salesforce is a plus.Some programming experience is a plus.Strong teamwork skills and work ethic; a collaborative work style is essential.Resourceful, well organized, highly dependable, and efficient.Strong verbal and written communication skills.The duties and responsibilities described herein are not a comprehensive list. Additional tasks may be assigned to the employee and the scope of the job may change as necessitated by business demands.First Eagle Investment Management, LLC (FEIM) and First Eagle Alternative Credit, LLC (FEAC) is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. About adMarketplace

With 20 years of search marketing expertise our goal is to add value to every search. On the simplest level we are the largest consumer search technology platform outside of Google and Bing. adMarketplace delivers incremental search traffic across native channels, including mobile apps, consumer sites, and browsers. Our technology enables audiences to skip search results pages and navigate directly to trusted sites in moments of intent. As well as driving incremental reach we are also market leaders in terms of privacy and performance.

The Role

We have a fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our growing team. The right person will be a champion of big data who can extrapolate big ideas from data analysis. You will support key projects to deliver scalable solutions that tackle our biggest business challenges.

What You'll Do:

Synthesize raw data into actionable insights to drive business results, identify key trends and opportunities for business teams and report the findings in a simple, compelling wayDevelop a deep knowledge of data, partner with business leads to provide data sets and ad hoc reporting to solve day-to-day issues or answer key questions from our business teamsWork closely with product analyst team to support data projects of varying degrees of scaleBuild reports and dashboards via our new business intelligence platform

Qualifications:

BA/BS degree or equivalent, (Math, Statistics, CS, Engineering background preferred); 1-3 years of relevant experienceAble to organize large data sets to answer critical questions, extrapolate trends, and tell a storyHighly proficient knowledge of Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, formulas, functions)Experience with SQL and databasesPython and scripting languages is a plusExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAble to understand key business drivers; strong attention to detail combined with an ability to see the big pictureEagerness to learn and grow professionallyInterest and/or experience in advertising a plus

Job Title: Business and Data Analyst Job Description

The Business and Data Analyst will be performing business and data analysis on several inter-dependent, highly complex data requirements across several lines of business in the Investment Bank. Successful candidate must have strong analytical and problem solving skills, domain knowledge in financial services such as post-trade processing. The candidate must be highly collaborative, a clear and concise communicator both verbally and in writing.

The candidate will be responsible for gathering the requirements for several lines of business regarding client trades, accounts, reporting and reference data. The candidate should have a strong understanding of at least one of the following businesses: Fund Services, Custody and Investment Accounting.

The candidate will have responsibility for gathering and analyzing requirements, writing functional and data specifications, and working closely with senior business users to validate prior to application development. A key part of the role will be data interrogation, mapping end user requirements and data specifications. In addition, the role will require involvement in an iterative software development model, requiring agility and flexibility on the part of the analyst to handle requirements changes.

The Business and Data Analyst will work with application development teams and their interdependencies to understand, document and interpret complex requirements. In addition, this candidate will work closely with business partners and data owners, to define, track and manage various data migration and data quality work streams.

Client management is an integral part of the role, and as such the successful candidate will be responsible for project governance, including managing user groups and communicating status to senior technology and business sponsors. Excellent verbal and written communication will be essential for effectiveness in this role.

Qualifications

• Minimum 3 years of experience as a Fund accounting Business Analyst with focus on data analysis in the financial services industry.

• Must be have a strong understanding of SQL.

• Strong written and oral communication skills, with ability to demonstrate analytical thinking and problem solving skills.

• Able to forge productive working relationships with senior business users and business managers.

• Ability to analyze complex cross functional business processes and define integrated requirements.

• Ability to facilitate the design of integrated solutions (process, technical & organizational).

• Can ensure the end to end solution will deliver the required business results.

• Drives adoption of the designed processes and solution use with stakeholders.

• Communicates with business SMEs to ensure expectations are kept in line with project status.

• Drives the definition, testing, training, and implementation of functional requirements. Upon implementation, drives knowledge transfer to Production Support.

• Creates/revises/executes the following deliverables using industry standard techniques as necessary, including but not limited to: process maps, data flow diagrams, requirements specifications, functional specifications, use case scenarios, acceptance testing.JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Company DescriptionFAST, which stands for “Flexible Architecture, Simplified Technology,” is a Verisk (NASDAQ: VRSK) business that offers a suite of out-of-the-box software components insurers can use to quickly modernize their current environments or replace their legacy systems. FAST, which has a U.S. office in Iselin, New Jersey and an international office in Hyderabad, India, was founded in 2010 to provide an alternative to the overly burdensome solutions available in the market.

At FAST, we recognize that each insurance company faces a unique set of issues and challenges, and that a tremendous amount of creativity and capability is required to craft and implement the best solution. That’s why FAST was built on an agile mindset. FAST, in concert with Verisk, is focused on providing innovative technology and analytics solutions for the life insurance industry. We’re continuously learning and improving, constantly challenging the status quo, and always seeking a “win/win” for our customers, partners, and employees. We reduce the time to market, eliminating risk and lowering the cost of standing up and maintaining core insurance systems.

We continue to leapfrog the competition through Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Life Insurance Policy Admin Systems, North America. FAST was first recognized in Gartner’s 2015 Magic Quadrant and after only three years became the youngest company to make Gartner’s leadership quadrant (upper-right).

We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!

At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.

Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.

But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.

It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.

At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.

At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.Job DescriptionThe Business Analyst works as a consulting team member or an individual consultant on an implementation, enhancement, integration, or special project(s). Expertise and work efforts are focused on the research, analysis, and implementation of client goals, and on the needs of the general business environment. Duties may be performed at customer’s site. Operates under close supervision and works on tasks as directed. Works under clearly defined guidelines.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

90-100% Works on small-sized projects or specific components within a larger project, usually performing basic design work, configuration and testing.

Performs configuration tasks on a system component.Executes enhancement and system level test cases.Provides support to customer’s test efforts.May assist in analyzing customers' business requirements and technology objectives; may develop a specification to meet customers' business needs.Prepares status reports, as needed, on all project activities.Performs simple to moderate configuration as part of story implementation

<10>QualificationsEssential Education and Work Experience

Bachelor's in Business, Mathematics or equivalent required. STEM degree preferred. Typically requires less than 18 months of experience in relevant industry business practices, business consulting, or technical consulting.

Specialized Knowledge and Skills

The BA must be intellectually curious, and demonstrate strong interpersonal, presentation, and planning skills. They must have highly proficient PC skills, specifically within Microsoft Office, preferably having prior technical experience.

Roadmap Skills for Attainment

These skills are vital for success in the Business Configuration Analyst I role, as well as, advancing your career at FAST and beyond. FAST is committed to helping you develop the following:

Basic proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including spreadsheets and basic calculation functions. Configure predefined “basic” orchestrations and rules. Debug Product Orchestration for purposes of testing Insurance Components functionality. Configure and run “basic” automated test cases. Configure basic data model entities and attributes.Clear understanding of role and responsibilities within FAST project methodology.Document software defects using predefined standards and tools (i.e., governance and phabricator).Working knowledge of the FAST platform to process business from end to end for two out of three using major Insurance Software Components (New Business, Policy Administration, Distribution Management).Working knowledge and ability to apply product concepts to at least 2 Life or Annuity products (FAST or Client.Define data relationships between key components and entities.Conduct story level software demonstrations.

Core Personal Attributes

The following attributes are required for success and must be consistently demonstrated by employees.

Problem Solving/Critical Thinking – Ability to synthesize content. Good problem-solving approaches. Communication – Articulate, clear and succinct. Good listener. Solid logic flow during discussions. Poised, personable style. Teamwork – Enthusiastic, highly involved team member. Supports others and helps build team morale. Engaged and high energy. Demonstrates integrity at all times. Goes the extra mile to help others. Strong network of informal relationships. Work Ethic – Completes tasks in a timely manner. Stays focused and organized. Self-motivated, takes initiativeTakes full ownership of assignments. High quality standards. Intellectually curious, openness to new learning and others’ views. Seeks and is responsive to feedback. Consistently follows through and demonstrates "can do behavior".

Equipment and Applications

PCs, spreadsheets, and various other software applications. Proficiency in Microsoft Office required.

Work Environment and Physical Demands o

General office environmentTravel requiredAverage 45-hour work-week, more as needed

At Reverse Mortgage Funding LLC (RMF), we are dedicated to helping older Americans live the retirement lifestyle that they imagined and deserve, in the comfort of their own home. Reverse mortgages are our only line of business and meeting the needs of this important segment of our society is at the core of everything we do. We are proud to be one of the nation's top reverse mortgage lenders.We are seeking a Trading & Analytics Analyst (Capital Markets Analyst) to join our Capital Markets Team in RMF's Bloomfield, NJ Headquarters. The Trading and Analytics Analyst will assist in a variety of capital markets functions, including but not limited to, servicing valuation, data analysis, model development and usage, report creation and maintenance, and interfacing with counterparties to execute, book, and troubleshoot trades.Principal Duties and Responsibilities· The analyst will perform financial analysis on RMF’s assorted assets and liabilities. This includes servicing valuation, GNMA HMBS valuation, and RBIT valuation.· Valuation duties consist of building, running, and maintaining models, in excel and 3rd party software.· The analyst will prepare monthly summaries on RMF’s financial assets and liabilities and prepare quarterly information on assets for the financial statements.· The analyst will conduct data analysis. Examples of this include analyzing the existing portfolio for refinance campaigns, studying the effect of such campaigns, and attempting to determine drivers of borrower performance.· The majority of time will be spent assisting on capital markets initiatives that present themselves during the year. Examples include involvement in new RBIT or RPIT securitization, working with NRMLA committee members on industry projects (like LIBOR transition), executing and booking trades, and working with other departments that require capital markets knowledge.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities· MS Office proficiency including advanced knowledge of Excel is required.· SQL, C#, VBA, Bloomberg, Intex, CAS, fixed income trading platforms are preferred.· Strong analytic skills and critical thinking a must.· Keen attention to details and asking critical questions area crucial for this work.· Entrepreneurial spirit and self-driven.Education and Experience· Bachelor’s degree with preferred major in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics required.· Minimum 1-3 years of related experience with a financial services firm preferred.If you are looking for a career opportunity with an exciting and growing company, please send your resume today! RMF is an EOE.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceDisability insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offReferral programVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplemental Pay:Bonus payWork Location:One locationCompany's website:www.reversefunding.comBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

About the Company:

Industrious' private offices and suites — the highest-rated workspaces in the industry — provide the most sustainable option for companies to manage newly distributed teams for the long term. We make it easy to find an office that works for you — even if you come in just once or twice a week. Recognized as one of America's 500 fastest-growing companies in 2020 by Inc. Magazine, Industrious offers flexible terms and locations in more than 50 U.S. markets.

As we shape the future of workplace experience, we're looking for motivated, thoughtful, and collaborative people who are excited to join a high-growth, warm, and welcoming team. For more information, please visit www.industriousoffice.com/careers.

About the Role:

As a Business Analyst, you'll partner with every department at Industrious, uncovering data-driven insights and working closely with senior leaders to frame the business. This is an amazing role for a curious, analytical mind who is excited to join a rapidly growing team and touch all elements of the business.

You will help answer strategic questions: Where should we put the next Industrious location? How should we price our spaces? What is the connection between our approach to hospitality and our net promoter score? What are the key drivers behind member-retention, sales and member-experience?

You are a great fit for this role if:

You thrive in a day-to-day partnership with senior-leaders, helping them frame the business and asking as many questions as you answer
You have an inquisitive mind and are adept and reducing complexity
You fluidly navigate data with sharp SQL and Excel skills

Responsibilities:

Conduct ad hoc analyses on a wide variety of data sources
Serve as a thought-partner to senior leaders
Develop and maintain core metrics for our unit operations, real estate, product, marketing, sales and hospitality teams.
Build dashboards and reports to share frameworks and insights across the organization

Requirements:

Strong analytical and communication skills
Experience working with non-technical users to understand business problems and map abstract problems to data that can be used to solve them
Strong SQL and Excel skills
Prior experience with visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker)



Perks:In addition to our incredible team, there are lots of other fun reasons to work with us.


Health care, including vision and dental
Learning & development grant
401K plan
Generous vacation time
Paid parental leave
Team activities and annual company-wide offsite

NextEra Energy Resources is one of the largest wholesale generators of electric power and renewable energy from the wind and sun in North America.
Position Specific Description
eIQ Mobility, a subsidiary of NextEra Energy Resources (NEER), is a data science and software company based in San Francisco, CA. eIQ Mobility is the leading software provider of fleet electrification solutions, building the most trusted platform that drives vehicle fleets into a smart, electric, and cost-effective future. eIQ Mobility was founded in 2018 in response to the unique roadblocks that corporate and public fleet leaders face in electrifying their vehicles, starting with identifying ‘where and how’ to electrify. Using its EValuate product, eIQ Mobility has assessed vehicles for EV feasibility for Fortune 500 companies, EV manufacturers, utilities and public fleets.
Role Description
We are looking for a Data Analyst to lead our EValuate customer engagements and fleet electrification program development. As Data Analyst, you will work closely with customers, partners, and eIQ’s data science and product teams to ensure customer satisfaction. The ideal candidate will enjoy both technical and customer-facing roles, have strong data wrangling and project management skills, and past experience presenting to large and often inquisitive audiences. This is an exciting opportunity to advise clients as they take their first steps towards electric vehicles. The customer insights gained will also play a key role in improving and scaling our EValuate product, helping customers achieve decarbonization at scale.
Responsibilities
Manage fleet electrification customer engagements from start to finish
Work closely with NEER and its partners to implement new electrification initiatives
Collect, process, and analyze client data using Python or R
Document customer and partner pain points; identify ways to streamline engagements
Present analysis findings and EValuate results to internal/external stakeholders
Job Overview
Employees in this role conduct complex operational analyses and lead medium to large project teams that support informed decision making within the business unit.
Job Duties & Responsibilities
Conducts analyses and prepares reports that provide operational and/or technical support to business operations
Conducts quantitative and qualitative research to support medium to large special projects
Assists with process design and modification for continuous business improvement
Performs other job-related duties as assigned

Experience: 3+ years

Our client is hiring an experienced Business Analyst. In this role, you will manage analytical projects and have the opportunity to partner with product, engineering & marketing teams to solve some of our digital businesses’ most challenging issues. You will have the opportunity to present data-driven recommendations & implement them across our various marketing channels.

Responsibilities:
Develop, own & maintain automated reporting infrastructure.
Work with marketing channel leads, manage data streams across all marketing channels, develop both standardized and ad hoc reports and dashboards.
Leverage API solutions from marketing partners such as Google & Facebook to aggregate performance across channels.
Support in conducting A/B and multivariate tests on our website & across our marketing channels.
Work with analytics teams to implement and troubleshoot marketing tags.
Proactively identify issues and opportunities and drive solutions.
Create analyses that give insight and direction to the business.
Support test & learn approach to marketing channels – be capable of extracting and analyzing data independently, interpreting results, suggesting next steps.
Turn business questions into functional analysis – understand the core financial impact in terms of sales, profitability, and KPIs Collaborate &
Create and maintain dashboards and identify opportunities to improve performance.
Lead measurement and analyses at a marketing channel level, ensuring we are appropriately measuring performance and impact.
Collaborate cross-functionally as well as clearly communicate updates to ensure successful and timely completion of deliverables.
Proactively analyze information to help guide the business.
Deliver actionable insights and recommendations supported by data to help improve the business.
Monitor performance on site as well to enable a data-driven approach for marketing strategy.
Understand business needs and anticipate questions/requests based on your understanding of the business and the data.
Be able to think on your feet and evaluate situations and numbers real-time.

BS or MS degree in mathematics, engineering or statistics preferred.
1-3 years’ experience in an analytical role.
Excellent analytical ability. Must have a data-driven approach to solving problems.

Execution minded analyst including strong tool capabilities Intermediate to advanced proficiency in SQL (experience in writing complex SQL queries).

R or Python is a plus.
Experience with Tag Management platforms (Google Tag Manager preferred).

Experience with Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint.
Detail-oriented, with demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Collaborative team player.

Who We Are

HomeLight is a venture-backed technology startup revolutionizing the $1 trillion real estate industry. Our mission is simple – we empower people to achieve better outcomes during one of life’s most important events: buying or selling their home.

HomeLight’s technology analyzes millions of home transactions to determine which agent or cash buyer is right for you. We also offer innovative financing and closing solutions, creating an end-to-end real estate experience that's simple, certain, and satisfying.

We pride ourselves on our company culture – but don’t just take it from us. We’ve been recognized as a best place to work by Forbes, Inc. Magazine, and the San Francisco Business Times. Our team breaks barriers every day while staying committed to HomeLight's goals and core values, which is a crucial element to our shared success.

Who You Are

You are a systems thinker, with an ability to quickly learn how different parts of the business interact.

You love working on hard data problems, combining data from many sources to drive value for the business
You will need to solve for multiple strategic priorities (i.e. growth, efficiency, and quality) and consider various stakeholders (buyers, sellers, agents, and employees). Each week will bring you a new set of projects and challenges, where success is measured by data-driven outcomes.

As a BizOps Analyst, you are the perfect mix of analytical, technical, and operational. You will collect, sanitize, analyze, and synthesize data; apply critical thinking & communications skills to make actionable recommendations; and drive those recommendations thru to execution. You are a clear, confident communicator who loves taking a complicated problem, decomposing it, and building a compelling business case.

What You’ll Do Here

Create and monitor metrics to support the optimization of HomeLight’s fastest growing and financing business lines, HomeLight Trade-In, Cash Offer, and Home Loans.
Build dashboards for a variety of audiences: executive, operational, management to empower us to run our business efficiently
Work extremely cross-functionally, attending to various projects with our Finance, Product, Engineering, Marketing, Analytics, Executive teams, and more
Beyond analytics, you’ll work closely with sales, ops, and product to help problem solve operational issues
Be an all-around team player - as an operator in a growing start-up your responsibilities will constantly be growing and evolving

You Have

SQL proficiency, required
Excel/Google Sheets proficiency, required
Experience using R (tidyverse) or Python (pandas) is a plus
Experience accessing data from APIs is a plus
Experience with Tableau, Apache Superset or other business intelligence tools is a plus
Excellent analytical skills, including the ability to analyze data, draw conclusions, and offer recommendations
Intellectual horsepower and the ability to think through a broad range of business issues
Experience working cross functionally with technical and non-technical stakeholders
Great verbal and written communication skills
Experience in real estate (sales, escrow, title, tech, etc) a plus
Experience in operationally-intensive businesses (e.g. proptech, ecommerce, ridesharing, food delivery) a plus

Let’s chat!

Who we are:

MasterClass is transforming online education by enabling anyone in the world to learn from the very best. We are deconstructing what makes an actor able to cry on demand, how an athlete defies gravity, and what it takes to write a bestseller. Our online learning content is available to students anywhere anytime, which supports our mission to ignite the greatness in others.

We are a quickly growing VC-funded startup based in San Francisco, with additional offices in Los Angeles. We have created online classes taught by famous masters— Gordon Ramsay, Serena Williams, Neil deGrasse Tyson, Sara Blakely, David Sedaris, Bobbi Brown, Timbaland, Anna Wintour and many more to come.

Since launching in 2015, we have been growing our team. Apply now to find out more about what we are doing behind the scenes.

What we are looking for:

We are building "the navy seals" of strategy & operations. A small team that can do everything from analysis & strategy to implementation. This small team will push each other intellectually and operationally to help push forward the most important strategic initiatives inside of Masterclass, such as international and new product expansion. In addition to partnering with the team, you will work autonomously and help drive projects with the Marketing, Business Development and Content teams and cross-functionally with Analytics, Consumer Insights, and others.

You are a good fit if you are: You are ready and excited to roll up your sleeves. We are a fast-growing, nimble organization and you will be asked to perform tasks with varying degrees of difficulty. You are prepared to perform more routine tasks on the same day that you prepare an analysis and a presentation to the executives of the company.

Responsibilities of the role:

Conduct ongoing analysis of key business drivers, trends and performance indicators - for the business overall as well as for select teams, including Marketing, Content, Business Development and others.
Inform content planning and drive the selection of our future instructors with a combination of strategic insights, learnings from existing classes (analysis of performance, qualitative insights) and research
Develop actionable insights to inform marketing strategy and support the optimization of our paid marketing campaigns
Support critical company initiatives (holiday strategy, analysis for pricing optimization, international expansion, exploring a B2B offering etc.) with problem solving and actionable analytical insights; help identify opportunities to improve core business metrics and to increase efficiency to support hyper-growth

Requirements:

1 - 2 years of experience in a highly analytical environment - top management consulting firm, investment bank or equivalent, and/or tech/ media/entertainment company
Superb modeling skills and extensive experience conducting a quantitative and qualitative analysis
Prior experience in Media and/or Education a plus (but not a must)
Experience in/with Marketing in a highly analytical capacity (also a plus)
A passion for the mission of MasterClass


At MasterClass, we believe we put our best work forward when our employees bring together ideas that are diverse in thought. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. In addition, MasterClass will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you have a disability or special need, we would like to know how we can better accommodate you.

Point B Direct, a subsidiary of Point B, Inc., focuses on matching candidates with the right role and the right culture. Our value-fit approach will allow you to feel confident and successful while building your skill set for the next project and reaching your goals. Point B Direct work is project-based, contract roles. You will work directly with our customers and become an extension of their team – delivering value with each project you touch.
Opportunity:
Point B Direct is working with a client who is looking to hire a contract Business Systems Analyst. The role is fully remote but preferred in San Francisco, CA or Atlanta, GA.

Project Background:
The Business Systems Analyst will work to solve organizational information problems and requirements by gathering and analyzing requirements; designing end-to-end workflows that combine client owned and operated services, third-party vendors, and manual functions built to scale with growing MAU and products/product features computer programs; recommending system controls and protocols.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Analyze current business processes and make recommendations for improvement
Work with clients to understand requirements using interviews, document analysis, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis.
Create and present reports to executive team members and shareholders to support recommendations
Oversee implementation of technical projects from inception to completion
Use a variety of data analysis and organizational tools to derive uncover insights and propose optimizing solutions via internal and external solutions
Determines operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats
Designs technical/systems solutions by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.
Recommends controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.
Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements; forming project teams; establishing project budget.
Skills:
Experience identifying, documenting, and prioritizing requirements for business or technology projects
Demonstrated an adept understanding of end to end business flows and the ability to translate those flows into system solutions
Working knowledge of various business analysis tools and practices to produce deliverables
Worked within more than one project or system development methodology (agile preferred), across multiple phases of the project lifecycle
Worked in a Business Analysis capacity for at least 3 - 5 years
Exhibits strong analytical, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills capabilities paramount to tackle complex deliverables.

Independent Contract
